author: {'steamid': '76561198376990807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1600393789}
review:
I really wanted to like this game. It promises to provide an opportunity for realistic tactical engagements at the platoon level, with detailed modelling of combat. It looks like it has lots of good stuff under the hood. However, the user interface is very poor. For example settings are done with buttons that change their label with the state of the setting. It is not clear whether pressing the button selects the state depicted on the button or whether that is already the state of the setting and pressing it will change the state.  Many symbols on the screen as unlabelled and use unexplained color codes. Other symbols with explanations, such as Target Infantry have an integer beside them, in this example, 4. What does 4 mean? The instructions are very poor, with no explanation of how to play the game, just a big bag of facts presented in random order. The tutorial starts you in a scenario and tells you how to do a couple of things, like move a unit to a particular location. Then the tutorial information just stops. The scenario keeps rolling, but you either watch events passively, or use trial and error.

I am not a stranger to this genre. I've played many table top hex games from Avalon Hill, etc. and many computer versions from Slitherine, etc. Steel Panthers, the Close Combat series, etc.  My respects and sympathy to players who have figured it out (but how will you really know ?), but I am not willing to invest that time. I've requested a refund.

Graviteam, please strike a deal with someone to redo the user interface for you. You have programming talent and a vision I like, but I found you game unplayable. Like others, I will try the game again if you rebuild the UI and provide useful documentation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006705935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 3456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1711220265}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050456706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 9154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 1406, 'last_played': 1711630335}
review:
In my opinion this is the best historical tactical simulation out there (single-player). Sure, it has some flaws (particularly in the UI and user experience departments) and its steep learning curve requires you to dedicate some time to learn the ropes. But once you do, everything "clicks" and you're in for a treat if you like this kind of games.

The strongest aspect of this game is in the historical department. Each campaign (called operations) has been meticulously researched by the developer team. The orders of battle, the weaponry and the map layout (with a little effort you can find the real locations in google maps) make this game "feel" authentic. 

This is not a game for everyone. You cant micro-manage your squads, so instead of giving detailed orders to each unit you need to give 'general' commands and let your platoon and squad leaders do the rest. Sometimes it can be frustrating watching your soldiers doing something weird, but you need to remember that the individual units lack the overview vision you, as a player, have. Just like in real war, people make mistakes, the soldiers get distracted and bad things happen.

Most of the DLCs are great. However, if you own the previous game (Operation Star) you are going to see that some of the DLCs are just the same campaings updated to the new standards and ported over. I own both games plus their DLCs and after putting more than 250hrs in the series I think its worth the price tag. To me, the DLCs covering post WWII conflicts are the best, although most of the game is focused on WWII.

TL;DR: It's the best tactical sim you can get as long as you are willing to spend time learning the ropes and getting used to the UI. If you like this kind of games, this one is a must have. Get it on sale if you are not 100% convinced, but it's certainly worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027590889', 'num_games_owned': 707, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1048, 'last_played': 1697486443}
review:
What can I say? This is the ultimate east front simulator for company and above sized combat, nothing else comes close. The game looks incredible and runs extremely well. The real treat of the game though is the AI system. You give very few orders as the commander, usually as simple as "attack here" or "defend here" with a few guiding rules like using smoke/moving formation/etc. The lack of micromanagement is great and the AI is pretty good at both following orders and improvising to on the ground conditions. Which is good since giving orders on the fly/after the battle starts costs "command points" and you'll want to keep these hoarded for dire emergencies 
Scenarios are at the operational level and turn based while the battles play out in real time, sorta like a more accurate total war
you can also set up custom quick battles if you just want to watch your tigers or KVs run over some helpless shmucks 

The devs really know their stuff and the areas you're fighting over are accurate and the forces you're using are the historical forces present on that day and hour. The DLC is always pretty great, usually adding a new scenario or new time period with the associated toys, like Angolan Civil War or the Sino-Soviet Border Conflict.

The biggest issue for new players is going to be breaking past the UI and some of the features that aren't described as in depth in the manual. I highly suggest that you check out thewarsimmers guides to Graviteam Tactics. Once you understand how it works, it makes the game incredibly easy to play, especially compared to some other wargames 

It's a solid 10/10 once you break past that UI

author: {'steamid': '76561198367795559', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1634646604}
review:
[h1] Что такое Graviteam Tactics: Mius-Front [/h1]
 Эта игра представляет из себя стратегию, при том очень старается быть максимально реалистичной, что, к слову, не сильно то выходит. Но если сравнивать её с каким-нибудь Call of Duty, то вроде как и реализм прёт, даже стратегия появляется.
[h1] Плюсы [/h1] 
+ Красивые модельки юнитов [spoiler] хотя, если всматриваться, можно найти неплохое такое мыло, но только если специально его искать [/spoiler]
+ Эффекты взрывов и тп довольно хороши (хотя огонь и 2D)
+ Карты довольно неплохи
+ Система появления окопов при выставлении юнитов в обороне
+ Взаимодействие родов войск (пехота идёт прячась за танками, артиллерия бьёт по наводке и тд)
Собственно, на этом всё.
[h1] Минусы [/h1]
-Тупой AI. Причём не только противника, но и ваших солдат. Простой пример: мои солдаты после получения приказа о быстром движении стояли и смотрели друг на друга, изредка меняясь местами. Но через минуту всё-таки забили на построение и побежали так, правильно выстроившись уже в процессе. Если разработчики так хотели воссоздать реальную суматоху и подготовку к атаке, то готов их поздравить, это так не работает. К слову враги тут тоже туповаты: они могут пойти в абсолютно бессмысленную атаку, а через 10 секунд осознав всё броситься бежать. Но основная претензия у меня всё-таки к AI юнитов, так как он никакой. Его максимум это посадить бойца в кукурузе и отказаться открывать ответный огонь, так как ему можно, он же интеллект.
- Озвучка. Может я избалован фильмами и играми в нормальном дубляже, но мне просто больно слышать красноармейцев. Реплик довольно мало [spoiler] Они ещё и повторяются, я во время марша словил три одинаковых подряд [/spoiler], так ещё они ужасно озвучены. [spoiler] Я СУКА СЛЫШАЛ ЭХО... ЭХО БЛЯТЬ В РЕПЛИКЕ ПЕРСОНАЖА... [/spoiler] Неужели так сложно было не самим озвучить реплики, а отдать это дело знающим людям? 
--- Интерфейс. Он достоин трёх минусов. Чтобы разобраться в нём нужно отыграть часов этак 25. Тактическая карта перегружена до невозможности, 40000 значков слева которые непонятно что обозначают слегка путают новичка, ну чисто слегка. Я прошёл обучение, но прям удивительно понятным и простым всё не стало. Даже после 2 прохождения. К приказам претензий нет, всё ясно. 
-_- Запуск во втором окне. Я не программист, так что не знаю нахуя это было нужно. Из такого вытекает ещё один минус: потеря сохранения после изменения настроек [spoiler] Даже сука ЗВУКА  [/spoiler].
- Это DLC, детка!!! Кто не любит 3524 DLC к купленной игре? Да нет таких! Учитывая, что в игре без пары-тройки дополнений делать практически нечего.
[h1] ИТОГ [/h1]
 Часто люди пишут, что сейчас игра не торт, но вот потом брать нужно обязательно. Не тут. Я не вижу смысла ждать пока что-то допилят, ибо большинство недостатков придётся исправлять 510 лет, а я за это время смогу отработать комплект силовой брони MK2. Короче, берите только если посмотрели на сие творение на ютубе и влюбились, без просмотра роликов по игре не спешите её покупать, а то она может подкинуть пару нежданчиков.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013055074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 72995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59032, 'last_played': 1701848511}
review:
An absolutely fantastic battalion level strategy game/simulator with MANY amazing DLC covering mostly the Eastern Front of WW2 plus a handful of operations during the cold war. The great ballistics and physics engine, though certainly showing its age sometimes, makes for a very realistic simulation of vehicle damage. Damage to vehicles is not health based like most games, but instead is based on the actual damage sustained to internal components and crew. Graphics are decent (MUCH better than Combat Mission LOL) but, like I said, the engine is aging, and the AI pathfinding for vehicles can get janky sometimes. 

Unit movement on the campaign map and unit placement/movement before and during the actual battles is key, and you will have to be smart about your tactics and where you send your reserves etc.

 The learning curve is very steep and there are no real tutorials aside from the downloadable manual, so reading the manual and watching videos or reading guides online will be essential to figuring out the games mechanics and proper tactics. It's fairly hard to learn and very hard to master. This may be off-putting to those who aren't familiar with simulators, but to me the difficulty of mastery makes it very rewarding. 

All around just another banger from Graviteam. A must have for anyone who loves tactical strategy and spectacular tank battles!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998818936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 24650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16498, 'last_played': 1671076414}
review:
I'm a huge fan of RTS games like Men of War and have played RTS games since I was little. 

Graviteam tactics isn't like other RTS games in the same way that one martial art, like boxing for example, isn't like other martial arts even if they're all martial arts. You have the same tools to work with but you work with them in a different way. For me getting into graviteam tactics was super weird, I knew what I was looking at but I learnt the hard way that I wasn't familiar with this kind of gameplay. Even with the fog of war turned off I had a hard time winning at first.

Since I didn't look at any guides or tutorials it took me around 20 hours before I started enjoying the game. The first 20 hours were spread out over half a year, I'd try for a few hours and get frustrated because my guys were just getting slaughtered, I did no damage and felt like I had no control. Then slowly I started to wrap my head around how the game is played and I've had a blast since. 

The combat is EPIC! The firefights are insane compared to other games, the way you play the game gets you thinking about what to do in a very different way. It's hard to explain, but it's like being a boxer and getting into wrestling. I don't play games to learn, but I feel like what I've learnt from graviteam definitely has improved my gameplay in RTS games because it's got me thinking about moves on a level I wouldn't have thought about otherwise.

I recommend this to anyone who likes RTS games. It'll take a few hours to get into but once you do... :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198082480390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3670, 'last_played': 1644481205}

author: {'steamid': '76561198198096765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 11857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3628, 'last_played': 1628182941}
review:
Muy buen simulador de batallas tácticas del frente del este la 2GM. Acostumbrado a juegos por turnos (Steel Panthers, Combat Mission) me está gustando y sorprendiendo este RTS, sobre todo por la profundidad, buenos detalles e inmersión, además de los gráficos.
Las armas y vehículos con sus características están muy bien recreadas, además de la moral, fatiga, y experiencia de los soldados y la utilización de armas combinadas, infantería, armas de apoyo, artillería, blindados y, ocasionalmente, aviación. Concretamente la artillería (en mapa y fuera del mapa) es fundamental, a diferencia de otros wargames en los que no es tan importante. Y las comunicaciones entre unidades es otro elemento que parezca que estamos ante un campo de batalla con vida propia.
Es muy interesante la combinación de escalas tácticas y operacional, que da sentido a muchas batallas. P.ej. en ocasiones te ves sobrepasado en una batalla en la que no puedes hacer frente a T34s o KVs con tus pequeños AT y morteros, pero si consigues dañarlos puede que no estén disponibles para la siguiente batalla. Además, la escala operacional es muy completa, como un pequeño wargame en el que manejas reservas, suministros, tienes que maniobrar teniendo en cuenta que te pueden aislar unidades, etc. y sin perder de vista que tienes que cumplir con los objetivos en los turnos fijados para cada operación.
Otro punto a favor es que no necesitas el molesto micromanejo de otros simuladores, como los modernos Combat Mission. Después de situar tus tropas y planear sus movimientos, con pocos clics puedes conducir la batalla, pues el sistema de órdenes está muy bien diseñado. Esto te permite disfrutar de la batalla con sus gráficos, sonidos y animaciones produciendo una inmersión como en pocos juegos de esta temática.
En cuanto a la interfaz, hay que dedicarle tiempo pero una vez que la comprendes te parece buena. Los problemas vienen más bien por el manual, que debería ser más completo.
En cuanto a los desarrolladores, no paran de mejorarlo con parches y añadiendo DLCs, cada uno con sus añadidos, además de una continua comunicación con los jugadores en el foro que se agradece y que hay que valorar muy positivamente.
En definitiva, un gran simulador de la 2GM.
Reseña común para el Mius-Front y para el Tunisia 43.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202029812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 143510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70323, 'last_played': 1644479340}
review:
I used to play other WWII RTS games and was always bothered by the lack of realism. Then I found this game. It is the game I had always wanted without knowing that somebody had actually made it. Features like realistic ballistics, simulated vehicule workings, recreated landscapes and so on make for an immersive experience like no other. The tank battles especially are gripping. In Graviteam Tactics, you actually feel a certain febrility before an imminent enemy offensive. As far as I know, this must be as close as a video game has gotten to realistic tactics.  I don't think I will ever go back to playing other WWII RTS games. 

With that said, the game is not perfect and has a few issues. The main one in my opinion is the sometimes horrible pathfinding of vehicules, especially when going in and out of entrenchments. This is often compounded by the command simulation system in which giving orders costs command points, thereby reducing the possibility of micromanagement. While this command system isn't bad in itself, the trouble is that it assumes a basic intelligence on the part of units which they presently lack, meaning that you often have to spend precious command points ordering a certain unit to do something which it would be able to do on its own in real life (like rotating to face the enemy). The enemy commanding AI also seems to me to be not that good on the operational level (only my impression), although it does fairly well on the tactical level. Many reviewers have complained about the unfriendly UI. It is true that the UI is not straightforward in telling you exactly what is going on when, for instance, a gun obstinately refuses to fire, but in about 80% of cases, you will be able to make it out once you've read the manual and maybe have done some trial and error. But that means that even after I've played hundred of hours, there are still about 20% of these cases which remain a mystery to me. It could be an AI issue. 

The other issues are minor and tend to be corrected over time, as the devs keep updating the game regularly, which is another important pro. Many campaigns have also been added and although they have to be bought separately, you can wait for sales to get them for relatively cheap. Besides, how much playtime you get for your money depends largely on how meticulously you place your troops in the deployment phase (personally, I am pathologically meticulous in placing my units, which goes a long way to explain my high number of hours played). It might also be worth noting that a few campaigns are not from WWII.

Despite my liking it very much, I should stress that it is really not a game for everyone. You have to be willing to forgive the errancies in pathfinding and the awkward UI. Some prior interest or knowledge about military history and tactics is probably the main factor that would make someone like the game and tolerate its flaws. For my part, I find that its pros are such that they far outweigh its cons.

Finally, I believe this game holds a whole host of possibilities and I'm eager to see what's next (a multiplayer?). My favorite video game of all time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967439706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 95061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 274, 'playtime_at_review': 24918, 'last_played': 1711884080}
review:
In my opinion Graviteam have created some of the best realistic war games out there, honestly nothing i could say will help you understand it, its a game you will either love or hate it. They have given enormous attention to details and you can see they are very passionate to their games.
The game has a steep learning curve but once you have the basics, it will grow on you. 
If your curious about the game, look it up on youtube/ect and see if its your thing.
I look forward to seeing what is next! (:

author: {'steamid': '76561198043435833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 108697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75497, 'last_played': 1646549395}
review: Im not the type to leave reviews but this game is seriously too good not to. Im not gonna tell you what  i llike about the game because there is far too much to discuss. This is simply the most realitic and immersive game about ww2 period. It is totally different than the more softcore ww2 strategy games weve grown accustom to and some people think there perception of infantry squads dropping grenades down hatches and being invincible is more important than the reality of the war. This simulates mostly early eastern front so realize that at that point the germans didnt have even equal tanks to the soviets. In fact the t34 will be th bane of your existance as germany, instead of fighting to the death like most games have taugght us use logic. Ask what do i want to achieve by keeping these men in this sector if itas simply to hold an unimportant parcel of lAnd why not retreast and attack with the correct reinforcements. Also realize that in some cases this game is anything but balanced because neither is history do you think the germans wouldnt use a weapon because it was too powerful? Im not trying to be rude but when i read people posting to the forums about how one side is too powerful they miss the point entirely. War isnt fair and even tho you might have no chance you can swtill complete every objective in this game on both sides if your think tactically. Thats the true beauty of this game. Just dont forget to turn off the hud and zoom  in to ground level every once in awhile. its amazing the stories that play out a lone infanrtyman fighting to the death. Machine gunners mowing down people across vast open steepe. I can honestly say this is by far the best game ive ever played and highly reccomend to not only strategy gamers but to any type of ww2 enthusiast even if videgames arent your thing. There are many youtube videos covering basic and in depth strategy for those that struggle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056844652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 16034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8738, 'last_played': 1599014769}
review: Learn the UI. It might seem overly complex at first, but once you understand what is going on you will come to appreciate it. My biggest complaint is Vehicle AI pathing and urban combat. Vehicles are horrendously bad at crossing bridges. I have had a single Sdkfz glitch through a bridge blocking the entire advancing column forcing me to restart the mission. All in all though this is a very fun game. Very realistic, very brutal and highly configurable to your own liking. Vehicles and infantry are period specific and everything is there that is to be expected of a WW2 Eastern Front game. This is a complex game, the UI is not streamlined for beginners, there is limited information available regarding the game, but if you can get past that this a very rewarding title with seemingly endless gameplay

author: {'steamid': '76561198085217103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 54427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11042, 'last_played': 1677756459}
review: Well, if you are much into history and you prefer battlefield simulation instead of full action paced shitty games for kids, like coh2, sudden strike etc. (believe it or not, I have tried them all) than its perfect game for you. Its  hard to start, because of huge amount of futures included in it, but once you understand it (it took me about 100 hours to fully understand basics) you will fall in deep love with it. Now, after 186 hours I can say, that this game from Graviteam studio is a MASTERPIECE. Im not much of a player myself, I was just always looking for battlefield simulation. Once I found mius front, I have deleted all of the other games and I can easily say that it became an addiction. Its crazy, cause Im grown ass man, but when i get new achievement in game Im happy like a little kiddo. Graviteam, THANK YOU FOR CREATING SUCH A WONDERFUL PRODUCT!!!!! Hope to see more dlc's in future, no matter the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022711320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 241163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 782, 'playtime_at_review': 88751, 'last_played': 1712344875}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069051747', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 26239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 148, 'playtime_at_review': 2806, 'last_played': 1711292307}
review:
Deepest WW2 sim I have ever played, from planning to logistical management this game really deliveres the true Eastern front and modern war experience ever.

The hopelessness of 10 T34s rushing your entranched units and seeing from the commanders view that you can't do nothing about it is something no strategy game has ever made me feel.

This game isn't unfair it just portrays the reality of war, war is not fair; Play your cards right and you might just get out of it alive.

10/10 definately recommended, it will take you some time to understand the mechanics and the game altogether, remember playing it isn't the problem, mastering it will take you forever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008063495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1706262608}
review:
Gameplay wise this Is the greatest WW2 tactical RTS ever made, along with Graviteams other titles. Where this simulator does well, it does REALLY well, BUT most of the problems and frustration come from the inaccessibility and often times lack of information. I mean do NOT expect to just jump into this game day one and expect to be fully aware of whats going on because you will have a terrible time, which is what I meant by inaccessibility. However that can kind of be overlooked I suppose, like if you're really wanting to step into the shoes of a commander in the Red Army or Wehrmacht by playing this then you should be ready to learn. Luckily I believe anybody can learn to play this with a degree of skill and win battles through a process of trial and error.

I have one serious serious gripe with the game though, and this is what keeps me from playing sometimes, that is its save systems. PLEASE for the love of god make the save system a little bit more reliable. Sometimes it can take up to an hour to set up your units in desirable positions, especially in defense. If you exit to the menu during this your units positions will not be saved and you will have to start over. I believe live battle progress saves though, but I often find myself having to completely restart after taking a break for a couple days and coming back. Considering battles can take an entire hour on top of the sometimes arduous deployment phase, the save system needs to be more reliable. As I do not always have multiple hours to play, this is what keeps me from playing the game a lot of times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046358774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5520, 'last_played': 1670517633}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069100726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1270, 'last_played': 1680931731}
review:
This is a wargamer's wargame: clunky, somewhat slow to learn the UI and controls, and iteratively detailed down to the smallest fractions. 

Once learned, the gameplay loop is extremely rewarding, but would benefit from deeper attention to continuity (i.e. longer campaigns with the same troops, like the original Close Combat series offered). 

This is a very real and accurately-simulated big-boy version of the IGO-UGO classic series Combat Mission. 

Meaty, hard to get into, but ultimately there if you ever want to learn real tactics and command. For what it is, it's 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023480890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2771, 'last_played': 1588103750}
review:
Задумка хорошая, но ее исполнение просто ужасно. Когда проходил учебные миссии, вроде выглядело все более-менее. Но вот когда дошел до кампаний, где пришлось применять весь набор возможностей управления... Управления в этой игре как такового нет вообще, либо оно настолько сложно и запутанно, что понятно только самим разработчикам. Квадратная (!) линия фронта (это даже не гексы!), где непонятно в какой стороне находится противник и откуда он вообще может атаковать. Долгая и нудная расстановка частей, как в наступлении, так и в обороне (единственное, что запомнилось в игре!), причем она совершенно не зависит от фактического положения войск и их расстановки пару часов назад на предыдущем ходу. Единственная рабочая тактика - ходить толпой от одной точки обороны к другой. То, что между ними, на линию фронта и результаты боя не влияет. Войска ведут себя как неуправляемое стадо баранов, бойцы одного подразделения разбредаются на десятки, а иногда и сотни метров друг от друга, и в бою ведут себя как типичные тупые боты. Окопы, похожие на раскопанные траншеи теплотрасс, без опорных стенок и блиндажей, и постоянно застревающие на них танки. Противник атакует так же - разряженным строем тупых ботов, ползущих стадом в нескольких десятках метров друг от друга. Разницы между разными режимами передвижения я вообще не заметил - что в разведке, что в атаке, что в штурме это беспорядочное стадо ботов. На марше никто никого не ждет. Те, что рядом, собираются в колонну, а за ними в догонку бегут те, что отстали на полкилометра в предыдущей атаке. Авиация вообще живет своей жизнью, атакует кого хочет, а кого не хочет - не атакует, никакого приоритета целей или квадратов я не увидел. Артиллерия поддержки то же самое. С 3-го раза в обучении удалось сформировать квадрат (почему не элипс?) артиллерийского огня, но вот в кампании этого не удавалось ни разу! Зачем нужны корректировщики вообще не понятно - обычно они просто ползают и стреляют рядом с пехотой. Какой в них сакральный смысл, понятно только самим разработчикам, во всяком случае, из обучения я его не увидел. Попытка создать засаду - тот еще спектакль. Стадо (оно же подразделение, отделение), направленное в точку и получившее приказ маскироваться, частью лежит в кустах, а частью обязательно выползает на дорогу как земляные червяки после дождя, где их благополучно и обнаруживают. Если же отправить их дальше от дороги - половина не будет стрелять, т.к. никого не увидит, а несколько "червяков" обязательно выползут из придорожной полосы на поле. Электронных мозгов занять кусты вдоль дороги у них не хватает. Нормально подползти к цели пехота тоже не умеет - в режиме разведки и скрытности обязательно кто-нибудь из отделения привстанет и высунет голову как суслик, демаскируя всех. Принудительно заставить их передвигаться по-пластунски невозможно. Для техники нет режимов стрельбы с хода или с коротких остановок. Перекатывается все исключительно на руках - ни одного тягача или иного транспортного средства, пригодного для буксировки орудий, я в бою не видел. В режиме стратегической карты два подразделения не могут занять один квадрат, как результат - все размазаны по линии фронта, потому что впихнуть их банально некуда, и вступают в бой исключительно по принципу прилегания к квадрату.
 Одним словом, никакие исторические штаты не могут компенсировать ущербности управления войсками и тактической убогости игры, даже в древней Дюне возможностей выбора тактики было больше. Уж лучше бы Гравитим занимался симуляторами, Харьков-42 в свое время был лучшим. А это... Однозначно жалею о потраченных деньгах и времени.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211548471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1469, 'last_played': 1663396857}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971414698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 7286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6745, 'last_played': 1643573270}
review:
I cannot recommend this game highly enough.  Great WW2 Eastern front simulator at the Company and higher level with a separate and detailed operational layer giving each battle a purpose and story within the wider campaign.
Good developer that is constantly improving their game and releasing DLC at regular intervals.
As a former Combat Mission die hard - I would not go back - Graviteam all the way.
It does have a steep learning curve, but after watching a few youtube 'how to' videos I had the essentials and the fun part has been learning how to improve and adapt my orders.
This is not an RTS and you will rarely if at all be ordering one squad or tank to do something, this is big picture battle plans which you get to watch play out in gorgeous 3D whilst you occasionally tweak orders to respond to changing battle plans or send in reserves etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970709461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 35883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17489, 'last_played': 1704837444}
review:
One of the best games produced by the 10's, a genre defining experience. 
It will take you time to adapt to the slow pace of the game and the fact it's not even certain this was designed to be a game.
But once you do, this game will become like a therapy, something you play like you would go fishing or something. Fishing is not particularly eventful, but apparently some people enjoy it. It is the same with this 'game'. A new genre, I told you.

If you want to experience the full package, get the Fateful Strike DLC and play as German.
You can really win it, I did it. Then you will believe you know what it was like to be on the eastern front. That's the main strength of the game, it manages somehow to be immersive, even though it doesn't look like it at first.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091569753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1697260522}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988858766', 'num_games_owned': 566, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1367, 'last_played': 1666750044}
review:
You simply will not find a more in-depth, detailed and authentic WW2 strategy experience than Graviteam Tactics: Mius Front, at least not outside of groggy wargames that run at like, 5 FPS and look like DOS crossed with an Excel spreadsheet. Instead, Mius Front, the second game in the series, not only captures the gritty tactical reality, tension, and challenge of Eastern Front tank and infantry battles, but looks damn spectacular doing it. Instead of abstract points, base building, or supply management, Mius Front throws you ass-first onto the muddy, pockmarked battlefields of Eastern Europe.

While the devs have made a lot of improvements to the UI and continue to update the game frequently, the learning curve is more like a sheer cliff at first, but there are manuals, videos on youtube, and an in-game tutorial that should help you make sense of it. Once you get the controls, you have to consider real platoon-level tactics instead of rushing Tigers or sending out hordes of T-34s without covering them with infantry support, recon, smoke, and even a preliminary artillery strike, otherwise you'll find that your brave tankers quickly become the unwilling occupants of burning steel coffins real fast.

There are also tons of DLC based on meticulously researched historical battles from 1942-1943. They include both the tactical tank scraps as well as a strategic metagame where you carefully shift units around and manage fuel, casualties, repairs and logistics in a persistent campaign. If you're bored of looking at thatch-roofed dachas and kulak manors, you can always try the more modern DLC Operation Moduler, which lets you take command of Cuban-Angolan T55s and BTRs in a valiant worker's struggle against apartheid South Africa. Or you can be the South Africans, I guess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062790655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 8971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2754, 'last_played': 1697978398}
review: Top Top Simulator - ballistics are awesome AI is awesome

author: {'steamid': '76561197999458614', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 27144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2698, 'last_played': 1710129545}
review:
First, don't let the interface throw you off. Learn it, and you'll understand why it works and looks the way it does. Many have complained of it, myself included, but you must extend your patience and you'll be duly rewarded. This game rocks!

I've played many hours of CoH, MoW, SD44, and others, and GTMF (GTOS and Tank Warfare Tunisia 1943) stands at the top for me. I wish I had started playing this and Operation Star years ago. It doesn't have multiplayer, which is fine by me, but other folks might be thrown off by the lack of it. I understand. 

This game doesn't hold your hand, and it requires your attention to detail. The battles demand proper strategy and tactics. There isn't the need to constantly give orders, the AI will try their best to fight for you. Sometimes they get stuck and do stupid things, but that comes with all games' AI.

Mius Front will challenge you, frustrate you, and entertain you, the Devs deserve kudos for an excellent job. I enjoy how the game makes you work hard to learn it, and YouTube videos will be a necessity. The depth of strategy and enjoyment makes it increasingly difficult for me to play the, more generic, war games like the ones I stated above. Mius Front is chess, the rest are checkers. 

Watching the battles unfold while zooming in is so much fun, as the infantry walk crouched behind tanks, Stukas and Sturmoviks attacking from the air, machine guns arching fire with tracer rounds, explosions from artillery, the screams, the bravado, and the weather--snow, and rain, and heavy fog. The methodical madness, chaos, and terror of war is alive in this game.

I give Mius Front an easy 9.5 out of 10, and after you learned it enough, it'll grab you and make you want to play it more.  Buy on sale or not, either way it's worth it...and let me again emphasize: take the necessary time to learn it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002554357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 584, 'last_played': 1707770908}
review:
인터페이스가 쓰레기 그 자체.

기본적으로는 별로 나쁘지 않아보일지도 모르지만 필수적인 몇몇 기능들이 ui 안쪽에 숨어있습니다.
예를들어서

1. 차량으로 대전차포를 견인 (양쪽 유닛 선택하고 E)
2. 연막탄 발사 (Ctrl+G로 전차은폐모드 켜고 G로 관측사격)
3. 이동명령 2차옵션 (우클릭으로 이동명령 링커맨드 열고, 명령아이콘 다시 우클릭)

이 세가지는 아예 UI 아이콘으로 보여질 않아요

그 외에도 전차 장갑-관통도표 도표같은건 실제로 적과 마주쳐서 포탄이 교환되기 시작한 이후부터 나타나서 (메뉴얼에 있음에도)한참을 찾았습니다_-; 여튼 단축키 좀 외우시고 메뉴얼도 좀 보셔야합니다 별로 직관적이지 않아요.

다만 게임은 재밌는 편이라고 생각합니다.
처음하시는 분도 위에 숨겨진 명령어들 좀 익히시고, 몇가지 버릇만 들이면 쉽게 하실 수 있다고 생각됩니다.

1. 유닛선택후 Ctrl ` 와 ` 로 관측 및 사격이 가능한 범위를 반드시 살피면서 게임하셔야합니다.
의외로 울퉁불퉁한 고저차가 있어서 300m안쪽까지 들어가도 LOS, LOF 둘다 안나오는 경우가 종종 있습니다. 배치할때도 각 유닛 Ctrl ` 해서 관측범위 확인하시고, 전차나 보병들이 공격나갈때도 Ctrl ` 띄워놓고 적이 관측범위에 들어오고 있는지 체크를 하셔야합니다.

2. 적과 포화를 교환하기 시작하면 장갑차량은 } 명령어로 상대방 포의 관통력과 내 차량의 장갑수준이 제시되는 도표를 볼 수 있습니다. 이걸 보고 몇미터 정도에서 싸워야 하는지 확인해야합니다 ( 반대로 ` 를 눌러서 내가 공격하고자 하는 상대쪽으로 지시선을 그어보면 내 관통력과 적의 장갑두께도 확인가능 )

* 다만, 장갑이 관통당할 염려가 없다고 하더라도 계속 쳐맞으면 모랄은 감소해서 전투불능이 되어나 갑자기 180도 돌아서 도망가다 뒈집니다. 스펙상으로 우월하다고 막 밀어넣으면 다 날려먹는 이상한 시스템입니다.
** 간혹 관측창으로 파편이 들어간다던지 하는 병신같은 이유로 장갑치가 버텨줌애도 승무원이 뒈지는 경우도 있습니다.

3. 관통당하지 않아도 모랄 떨어지는 문제도 있고해서 작전개시시 전차가 먼저나가면 안됩니다. 반드시 보병으로 시야확보부터 해야합니다. 보병도 병신같은 숨은 명령어가 좀 있는데, 보병분대를 shift 누르고 클릭하면 1조, alt 누르고 클릭하면 2조로 2원화가 가능합니다(기계화보병인 경우 shift 누른 1조는 차량, alt 누른 2조는 보병).
수색정찰 보낼때 분대 전체 들어다 보내지 마시고(매복사 당하면 12명 그냥 전멸함 Retreat 시킬 방법이 없음), 분대 반만 꺼내서 수색을 보내세요.

이 세가지만 제대로 하셔도 무난하게 게임할 수 있을 거라 생각됩니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044857055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1701897520}
review: Даже не знаю, что сказать об игре, наверное хорошая.  Игра у меня в стиме  больше трех лет. Все портит перегруженный боевой интерфейс. За то время, что она у меня находится, я так и не смог научится в нее играть. Прохожу обучающие миссии вроде все понятно, захожу в игру играю пять минут и все полный провал, потеря управления войсками и полное поражение. Ситуация как в той пословице, про чемодан без ручки "Нести не удобно и бросить жалко". И так она лежит у меня в библиотеке не востребованная, пылится. Разработчики может вы сделаете интерфейс боя попроще. Поставлю пока игре оценку плюс.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001364809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 2403, 'last_played': 1711434088}
review:
Got everything I need-you give orders to your pixel troops-you don't micro manage..developer CONTINUALLY updates and is active on the forums. Provides tools to mod the game.
People will go on about the UI.
Really????! 
You ever play ARMA games? Small learning curve. Instruction pdfs are better. Not excellent but good enough. Victories are not assued. But the AI is definetly a challenge. No multiplayer but I'm not into that. 

Played well over several hundred hours of Operation Star and all the DLC's so I bought knowing what to expect.

Remember a time in OpStar German half-tracks had my boys on the run in a forest but we stopped them in the village. My Ivans just filled one this half-track full of holes ..but it kept moving forward. Couldn't stop it.
Why?
Dead German soldier foot was on the accelerator.
That's the kind of details you will see in this game to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073235852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 1209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1209, 'last_played': 1586723182}
review: Разработчики ИДИТЕ НА..x.ОЙ Сразу скажу что покупал игру думал что буду в нее играть долго и получать удовольствие.Думал что игра обрастет глобальными исправлениями и будет просто топ в симуляторах.Но ничего подобного.Все что я сейчас выскажу будет вполне заслужено.Разработчики ленивые уроды которые наживаются на доверчивых игроках.Что они делают каждые 2-3 месяца выпускают DLC за 200-400 рублей ,в этих DLC нет ровным счетом ничего интересного,одни понты про историчность.Карты не проработаны и скучны ,хотели видеть кучу техники устроить крутой танковый бой?Забудте все что вы получите это раставленых солдатиков на карте местности приблизительно похожей на ту что есть .За 400 рублей может быть!!! Может быть вам дадут один или два танка.Если скупить все DLC  с игрой то это потянет более чем на 3000 рублей.Для сравнения STEEL DIVISION 2 имеет за каждую страну просто хреналион юнитов и стоит  2000 рублей !!! Анимация пехоты это самая ужасная хрень которую когда либо я видел в играх и менять ее никто не собирается солдат может крутится на месте потом упадет будет  хвататься за голову потом резко подорвется и возьмется за оружие и будет дышать так словно его носорог сейчас сношает в задний проход.Это вся анимация настолько топорно выглядит что хочется сразу же отдалить камеру .Геймплей по сути в этой игре можно тупа сесть и пить чай потому что от вас почти нифига не зависит если солдаты вздумают очковать то они будут очковать и не будут даже пытаться выполнить приказ .ТАНК Пантера пробивает русскую ПТШКУ с пушкой 150мм в лобешник!!! Под острым  углом в горку!!! Пехота залезает в окопы спокойно может повернуться жопой к врагу ,вражеский танк может спокойно не видеть пехоту в 2х метрах от себя.Кароче ты можешь вообще не управлять игрой ты просто там никто и звать тебя никак они там сами стреляются ты только смотришь ощущения что ты чего то решаешь нет .Разве только в начале когда приказываешь двигаться.Но хуже всего это потеря доверия к разрабам,я купил эту игру чтоб поддержать хорошую идею крутого симулятора ,а получил СИМУЛЯКР  c  уродской графикой  неуправляемыми юнитами и постоянным донатом в виде неинтересных тупарылых DLC конечно кто то скажет ну не покупай если не нравится.Але блин вы хотите сказать что за пару тысяч ты покупаешь игру с двумя танками двумя пушками и пехотой ????А все остальное докупайте за бабки.Нет спасибо такого говна мне не надо,я просто разочарован очень сильно разочарован ,неждал такой подставы даже ролики снимал чтоб поддержать разрабов ,о чем жалею.Не советую покупать чтоб не плодить подобную халтуру

author: {'steamid': '76561198067424011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 58988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 235, 'playtime_at_review': 8777, 'last_played': 1712344932}
review:
Много лет играю в творения Graviteam, еще со времен "Битвы за Харьков" которая выходила на лиц. диске с незабываемой системой активации через интернет который тогда был не так легко доступен как сейчас. Причем количество активаций было ограниченным) Потом покупал на Gamersgate, потом тут... И могу сказать игра становится все лучше с годами как хорошее вино а Андрей становится все более матёрым ироничным троллем) Хочется чтоб развитие игры не заканчивалось...

Всех прекрасностей тут не перечислишь, скажу просто что эта игра для меня как интерактивное документальное кино про войну. Смотришь и принимаешь посильное участие в принятии решений) Единственный на сегодняшний день минус - это звуки, но он легко исправляется благодаря модам.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071096719', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1191, 'last_played': 1635942627}
review:
[h1] 어쩌면 워게임, 어쩌면 토탈워 [/h1]

워게임+토탈워의 전투방식을 합쳐놓은 듯한 하드한 전략게임
현실성있고 무엇보다 세세한 컨트롤 없이 그저 유닛의 행동만 명령하면 되기 때문에 정신없이 플레이할 필요가 없다.

그러나 현실성이 높다는 건 불친절하거나 어딘가 맛탱이 가있거나.

1. 좆병신같은 AI는 복날 개패듯이 패야됨.
이동명령을 내렸는데 혼자 빙글빙글 도는 차량, 장갑차에 탑승하라고 했는데 탔다, 내렸다하는 개폐급보병 작전을 진행하는데 있어 타이밍 깨는 멍청함을 보임.

2. 시야각 시스템.
이 게임에는 시야각이 있는데 그 시야각이 매우 좁음.
발 앞에 있는 적 유닛이 아군시야각에 들어오지 않는다? 그럼 절대공격 안함. 아이컨택트해도 지들끼리 쌩깜. 씨발 무슨 크리스마스야?


전투를 지켜보는 건 재밌음. 근데 씨발멍청한 유닛새끼들 능지때문에 할 때 마다 답답해서 암걸려 뒤질 것 같다.

review:
UI is absolutely _horrendous_, I nearly didn't fire it up a second time but it's oddly compelling. I think it was someone from RPS that called it a WWII Memory Maker. Sums it up pretty well. You'll be watching YouTube tutorials for the rest of your life.

Oh, one last thing, night fighting as the flare-less Germans for the 4th time in a row is already getting old. If you pick the Krauts for the first main campaign maybe see a man about disabling night fighting.

Or start with the Dawn of Blau DLC, apparently that's the way to go for beginners.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028283658', 'num_games_owned': 33, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1641621578}
review:
If you don't like endless frustration then stay away. Now I know why the Germans lost the war, they have a complete inability to cross a bridge in an orderly fashion, their vehicles resort to ramming each other, stopping for no apparent reason, attempting to run over each other, tipping over and ending up in the river and creating a huge traffic jam when not  a single enemy has even been sighted.
Add to that the painful UI, awful tutorials, difficult mechanics and you end up with a  giant clusterfk.

author: {'steamid': '76561198374297127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1666552303}
review:
The game is deep, very deep.
An amazing simulation, probably one of the best wargames ive played. 
Why the thumbs down you say????

i bought it months agos, couldnt get the hang of the UI, and refunded
then i wanted to try again.
i watched several hours of gameplay guides after attempting and failing to get into it. Then bought it again and then had another go.

Second time round i knew how to work the game , but  the User Interface (UI from now on) , was frustrating as hell to use.
my other bug bear was the DLC.
Each DLC covers a tiny time frame, and only the vehicles of that time frame. 
I was hoping for the same approach that combat mission 2 BB had. All units from 1939-1945. in this game, you only get access to a few months worth equipment with each DLC.
The editor UI is a nightmare to use, the campaign UI is just as bad. Lots of people can use it , and use it well, I, (and many others) find it infuriating.

This is an amazing sim, but its so much hard work to use and so evil on the eyes during the setup phase (the most important part of any battle) that i just couldnt bear to use the game.

Id give the game a 9/10 for content, but a 3/10 at best for actual use.
A thumbs up and down inst enough to judge it

Im giving it a thumbs down, because if your like me, you always read more negative reviews than positive before buying a game and  your sitting on the fence about.

if your a positive thinker, the games got hundreds of thumbs up reviews and you wont be reading this.

shame for such a great game, who knows i may have another go in the future if it gets patched or updated.

EDIT , Game has had a UI patch, but ive not had time to try it, im in the middle of other games. As soon as i have tried it i will update the review accordingly

EDIT, UI Has Improved , but its still the same UI (just a bit tidier)
the maps still Use the colored squares, still not something i can play for more than a hour without getting a headache

author: {'steamid': '76561197988319683', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 55585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20890, 'last_played': 1707252481}
review: Easily the best of the sim RTTs which is impressive giving that it has very good competition from Combat Mission. Excellent graphics really capture the chaos of war and the actually intelligent AI keeps operations consistently challenging to the point of being occasionally frustrating. Very well developed operational system which makes each battle feel like it's part of a bigger picture. Probably some of the best unit AI I've seen in any RTT/RTS significantly reduces the need for micromanagement (which is actually discouraged), which although takes getting used to makes the game and especially larger battles much less tedious to play. Has an insanely high learning curve (I have probably hundreds of hours in combat mission and it still took me around 300ish hours to fully grasp most of the mechanics). Definitely not for everyone but a must have for any simulator RTT fan

author: {'steamid': '76561197975209475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 11539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11539, 'last_played': 1576335880}
review:
A fantastic game, 8/10 from me.

I come from playing Close Combat both single player and head to head campaigns and Combat Mission for far too many hours, and this game is the only thing since Close Combat V: Gold Juno Sword mod that really gave me a new satisfaction in the same vein. 

The learning curve is very steep due to a peculiar russian dev with a intense dislike for proper documentation, but it is well worth it, laying out detailed plans then zooming around the battlefield watching it unfold with the chaos of war all around is immensely satisfying.

It is single player only, and the operational map phase is rather clumsy and frustrating, but most other things are a work of art once you understand how to properly fight a battle (expect a lot of trial and error initially)

review: This is a great game!  I often passed it by, thinking it was a typical RTS. This is not a typical RTS. This is a turn based, battalion level, war simulation. The game mechanics took me about a week to get it, especially the arty strikes! Line of sight, means line of sight! OOB means OOB!  But when I did get it, it was worth it. Things like a lack of AA , platoons and destructible bridges was a disappointment. Once my entire infantry force was blown off the field by relentless air attacks! Not fair! Anyway great game! Looking forward everything this game has to offer! The Russian front... Lest we Forget.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960859503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1580934347}
review:
Let me start off by saying, I love war games, I love simulators.  The more complicated (read: realistic) they are, the more I tend to like them.
Having said that "GT:M-F" is so UNBELIEVABLY frustrating and opaque it beggars belief. 
I tried. I *really* tried  to get into it (*starts sobbing uncontrollably into his "Wehrmacht" pillow*).
I watched several HOURS of tutorials. I read guides. I read the manual. I read forum posts and discussions. 
I put in more prep than actual playtime and still it's like playing hide and seek in a pitch black room while wearing noise cancelling headphones. You are trying your best to have fun, but the deck is stacked against you.

The tutorial is a JOKE. I mean COME ON GUYS. It's not even remotely adequate. 
Most tutorials online are outdated or convey false information, adding to the problem.
The game is BARELY comprehensible in English. Don't even TRY other languages. Mostly unsupported.

The UI is a *MESS*. I mean Combat Mission: BtB from *2002* HAS A BETTER AND MORE CLEAR CUT UI THAN THIS GAME FROM 2016. I mean COME ON.
Usability is a mess in off itself. Have fun figuring out which platoon (in Battle Editor) has which units, because it's not stated. Sure you can probably check the Encyclopedia (starts seperately, yay!) or check some forums, but WHY can't you just tell me/us?

Then there are the opaque and *strange* game mechanics. 
Line of SIght and Line of Fire are a thing, so you take ~1 hour to set up your units, only to find out that the bushline blocking your view, doesn't actually block your view, allthough the game tells you it does. You *ALSO* find out that your PAK can't fire on that slowly encroaching target, allthough it has Line of Sight, because it's gun can't depress that much... how are you supposed to know how much that gun can depress itself? I have not the foggiest idea. 

Units don't spot other units with which they in CONTACT (e.g. getting shot at from) which are 100 METERS IN FRONT OF THEM (!). Definitely not a bug. It's definetly some obscure and realistically rendered game mechanic the dev probably will tell you about. How are you to know that? NO IDEA.

I WANT to love this game. It looks great. Sounds great. It has great tactical allure and apparent depth. It probably (?!) has great and realistic mechanics, but look at me, I tried this game for ~10 hours with at least the same amount of time reading guides and I can't even TELL YOU whether or not the game IS realistic or not, because it's all guess work at best. You ALWAYS ask yourself: "Is this realistic, or is this kind of a bug?" 

If you can stomach basically trying to fight the game to learn it's opaque mechanics you *probably* will enjoy the game tremendously. The question si though: Should you really need to *fight* the game to learn it's mechanics? IMHO: "No." 
I like games (even complicated ones) that *respect* my time and effort. This game clearly does neither of those things.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027303685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1963, 'last_played': 1697732702}
review:
This game is not for your average RTS gamer, but it should be. The immersion, strategy and gameplay it provides is unrivaled and hard to find elsewhere (if at all). Be advised that it is a more a simulator than a game, but that makes for amazing battles and unique moments. AI behaves differently every battle so replayability is insane. This game has had minor but important improvements. You can save and you can restart battles including the set up phase which makes it much more attainable to most players.

The main advice before you buy  is to watch Youtube tutorials. The gameplay videos IMO do not do it justice as most miss a huge amount of detail . Additionally I recommend you read about tanks or watch a series on Netflix called Age of Tanks if you are not familiar with WW2 armor as you will need some basic knowledge of tanks as the armor penetration and calibre of weapons are highly modeled, and if that doesn't make you drool than this game is not for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198228608412', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 57427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1135, 'playtime_at_review': 9784, 'last_played': 1712100248}
review:
this game is highly underrated in the ww2 community. it is the most in depth game of this kind i have ever seen. if youre on the fence about this if you have operation star, i would say go for it. you get a a ton of new features from operation star and has alot of new units like the panther, bt series of tanks, several versions of the t-34 spanning from the early versions to late war versions. allthough you have to buy dlc's to get access to those, the dlc isnt all that expensive for what you get. 

now for the pros and cons.
pros
*an active community and helpfull developers
*great visual effects and sounds
*in depth damage models and realistic gunnery
*supression and panicking soldiers are exellently simulated from a normal footsoldier to a tank crewman
*intersting scenarios with both small and large numbers of units
*great ordersystem and intuitive configuration of each order given
*helpfull tools for line of sight, line of fire, ui elements and options for configuring orders

cons
*ai has alot of time pathfinding problems and will sometimes give up on the order
*after battle damage report is a bit jaggy and sometimes wont show hits
*some elements of the game can be a bit confusing at times
*units with clear LOS to a target will stand idle and not fire
*mortars and artillery not firing even with a telephone connection and spotter having clear line of sight
*very few tutorials which doesnt go nearly as in depth as it should (for this reason i recommend The Warsimmer. link: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvIrv9q82r9adCth_mTOHJw/videos)

all in all graviteam has delivered another great game, and while it has its flaws, these are not something you encounter every battle. many of these are rare occurances so definately worth the normal price

author: {'steamid': '76561198003208488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 45663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 10, 'playtime_at_review': 45663, 'last_played': 1711606703}
review:
REVIEW EDITED IN 2022.

I have had ups and downs with this title but the developers have recently delivered some very welcome improvements to the game that address some of my top concerns. The updated UI is much easier to navigate and the expansion of the game's Options menu also helps a lot.

After a break from playing, I have just purchased the latest DLC and I am enjoying the title again. 

There are still some key things I hope will be addressed, particularly:

1. Armoured units are currently able to spot and engage entrenched enemy infantry at a distance, thus routinely winning battles without needing to close with the enemy. Combined arms should be much more of a requirement in these situations and entrenched infantry should be very hard to identify until they open fire.
2. Vehicle pathfinding and the 'bee dance' that seems to precede most movement. This is really annoying. Vehicles also crash into each other routinely.
3. Soldier behaviour in and around trenches; constantly popping up and down, in and out, or laying prone next to an empty trench. (I was an infantry officer for 10 years and I never saw this in real life. Actually, you can hardly see any soldiers on the field in real life.)

EDIT APRIL 2024.

Not much has changed with respect to the three issues I complained about above. Oh. And the developer is still overly 'combative'. Don't post in the forums if you want to avoid high blood pressure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198290100237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 848, 'last_played': 1707739190}
review:
相比于前作注意坦克：星光行动，米乌斯河有更加细致的UI和可能的优化，米乌斯河仍然是非常出色的硬核拟真类军事策略游戏，是营连级战斗的标杆级产品。
游戏的优点在于：第一，武器的射程，装甲单位的装甲和视野都非常拟真，几乎完全符合现实；第二，指挥链和通讯系统是部分拟真的；第三，相比较而言，例如战斗任务系列，有更好的画面。
缺点在于：第一，几乎没用的游戏指引；第二，没有PVP；第三，操作非常复杂，例如我至今母鸡如何牵引火炮（按e上车自动牵引），但是现在母鸡如何让间瞄火炮自动引导射击（也许根本就不行）

author: {'steamid': '76561197973632840', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1579208595}
review:
Comming from SD:Normandy 44 i can safely say - why on earth did i not know about graviteam and their games before. 

So much attention to details and accurate real life simulation is hard to come by. 

My first game i started out as Germany and i had 3 Maders, the plan was to use them to support 3 diffrent platons push into a little town. I did my setup and my platons started pushing in, and 2 of the panzers rolled right behind them. The third panzer did, to my suprise, not move. It turns out it was malfunctioning and it har to be repaired. So meanwhile my repair team is repairing my panzer, the platon is obliterated without their support.

So here we are, at the start of a great adventure i feel. Cant wait to find more great immersive details like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000254513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 977, 'last_played': 1635579345}
review:
Вроде бы реализм и сложность процесса в игре хороши в определенных рамках, так как невозможно передать в игре весь реализм. Поэтому во многих играх тактических серий он приносится в жертву , для повышения играбельности. В этой игре была попытка взять реализм за основу процесса. В итоге получается полное гавнище.

Симулятор сгоревшего пукана, нет кнопки "отсутпить" , пехота гибнет под огнем , свои мудачье-минометчики вредят больше вражеских пулеметчиков .

author: {'steamid': '76561198027696246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1635866914}
review:
I've been playing Graviteam games since Achtung Panzer: Kharkov 1943 (2010).  Mius is the latest in the line.
There is a learning curve, which isn't something for casual &/or arcade RTS [Red Alert; COH; Assault Squad; Steel Division etc] players to take lightly.  
GT games are not abstract or gamey, & I think they are aimed at serious & determined players, they seem to favor those with an interest in Military History as they attempt to simulate actual warfare, with players able to employ genuine historical tactics in order to succeed.   
I've also played Combat Mission in the past but since cracking the GT 'code' find all CM games to be a trial of micro'ing lower grade AI.
GT games have huge replayability & whilst difficult to master, work really well when understood.
The beauty of this game is you can literally issue orders at the beginning as overall commander, & hit start & watch the battle unfold without doing much else.  The troops try to carry out the orders & you don't need to micro.  
Having set up the field, you can just alter key unit directives to respond to the active enemy as necessary.  Like a real commander.
As a simulator there is no 'balancing' of units & campaigns.  These are historically accurate battles with all the inequalities of each modelled battle.  The battle editor allows players to make their own battles, & there is a  'come into battle' option for a quick fix of action.
There is a strong track-record of constant support & upgrade patches from the devs.  Some patches have added significant new features, new missions & map updates at no extra cost to the player.
If you are willing to unlearn the norm of RTS & put in the time getting your a$$ kicked you will be well-rewarded by GT games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106473347', 'num_games_owned': 407, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 26946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2578, 'last_played': 1702078098}
review: Brilliant RTS!!! Will never regret having this game in my libery. Since Iv been playing I have started to seek for more buying every DLC just to have what the game has to give and offer!!!! It’s unbelievable good. It’s like an over head bored game, planing and laying out your own army and doing your own thing from what you have to work with. Once your turn is over, the ui will have there turn and depending on what you or the ui have done. By advancing or not but when you do advance into war it turns into a completely different game by putting you where you are on this board/map and you and your units carry out war with the units you set out to fight with. Every time there has been a fight on that part on the map, if you fight on it again there is all the damage that has been done from the previous fight which is one of the things I love about this game!! Remembers everything, where trances and art fire has been. Tank fire and buildings distoryed! You won’t regret this game if you love this sort of game guys believe me :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197987395778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5338, 'last_played': 1583698486}
review: I'm an old school wargamer, who's been playing tactical, operational, and strategic level WW2 wargames since the 1970's with Squad Leader and the Avalon Hill/Victory Games line of boardgames.  Of all the computer-based games (Close Combat, Combat Mission, Theater of War, SABOW, Achtung Panzer!, Operation Star, among others), this one is the most fun!  It delivers loads of battlefield action, without the tedious and unrealistic micromanagement some games allow and encourage.  Excellent job, Graviteam!  Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197961949129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1646573807}
review:
I've really gotten in to this game now and I bloody love it! I've always enjoyed games like Company of Heroes and Assault Squad, but they never quite delivered what I was looking for. This wonderful game does! It is certainly a bit of a learning curve and a lot of people comment about the user interface, but to be honest that hasn't been the hard part for me. Just watch a few tutorial videos and you should be good, it's pretty simple once you grasp a few basic things. Check out [b]The WarSimmer tutorial videos: [/b] [url=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLWnLXaLqhVJiSBL5LCQCdM0Aozr91Gef7]Tutorials Playlist[/url]

The real challenge is getting your head in the right place to approach battles in the "correct" way. You can't just Zerg rush in this game, it takes planning and methodical execution. You need to put real effort into the deployment of your troops, taking cover and lines of sight in to account. Then after you've deployed you can give initial orders, and if all goes to plan you can enjoy the results with a minor adjustment here and there based on how things unfold. In general you shouldn't need to micromanage every unit, simply issue your orders and watch the AI do its thing. 

Oh and make sure your artillery and mortars in good positions and that their commanders have good views etc. The effects can be devastating, but if they're not positioned correctly they'll sit their in silence and that'll ruin your battle :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197998929999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 67776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5596, 'last_played': 1710961926}
review:
By far the best game of this type available commercially (and yes, it's better than Close Combat). Yes, the UI is not the best you can find, yes the game comes with skinny tutorials and a not-very-good user manual, but the reality is that once you get the basics and once you're convinced this is NOT a micromanagement RTS, you will 1) have the wargaming experience of your life and 2) learn something about history.

Actually, once you've checked out few tutorials / walkthrough / guides available on the net, GTM: MF is not even a complicate game. Difficult to master, yes. But complicated, not really. 70% of the effort goes into placing correctly your forces in the Deployment phase. So understanding the maps and the various placement options will make most of the difference between winning and losing – off map artillery being the trickiest part. The remaining 30% will be mostly deciding what initial commands (or list of commands) you need to issue to your forces, but believe me, you will rarely issue more than 10 to 15 orders. Once the actual combat is starter, you may have give a couple of orders here and there, but that’s it.  Sit back and enjoy the result (or cringe at you stupidity while your units are massacred on screen)

BTW: the quick battles and "ready to fight" meeting engagement (check the small icon on the lower left of the main menu...) are lost or won, but what will make the game worthwhile is fighting the historical campaign, but don’t jump on the Campaign right away. Spend your time with the tutorial (insufficient but still useful) then play a lot of quick battles to get the game mechanics. The learning curve is steep, but GTM: MF is a game that rewards perseverance.

Final vote 10/10 as far as tactical combat simulation go – probably the best I’ve ever played since Tacops 4

author: {'steamid': '76561198007392268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 7611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5073, 'last_played': 1694978173}
review:
+ Very cool graphics and atmosphere, especially on the winter maps
+ realistically scaled maps and weapon ranges; overall the intensity and feeling of the action is very realistic
+ many small details that are often overlooked in WWII games (flares, telephone wires, tank phones, ...)
+ detailed tank warfare (simulation of vision slits for spotting spotting; distance and angle affect penetration chances, detailed damage models, etc)
+ relative spotting system (units spot enemies individually and communicate with each other to share this information)
+ the attempt to combine the operational level with a tactical level is highly intruiging and promising. It makes engagements even more realistic (as you're more concerned with casualties in the long run and might also find yourself fighting very asymmetrical battles) 

- Unfortunately, the implementation of the operational aspect is handicapped by odd design decisions 
 and is also rather clunky, riddled with control and UI oddities. 
- extremely clunky and inconsistent UI and controls throughout the whole game - in the menus, the operational map and on the tactical map
- bad localisation (judging from the English version)
- bad documentation (tutorials insufficient, manual incomplete)
- The AI is okay, but no challenge in the long run; Combined with the lack of a multiplayer mode, this is a major drawback
- the behaviour of the devs in the forum has often been rude, bordering on hostile; devs seem overly offensive, even regarding aspects of their game that are in desperate need of improvement

In the end, it's a bad game, but an interesting simulator/program for experimentation. If you're searching for a competitive, balanced game with a market standard interface, this is not for you. If you're searching a simulator with a clunky interface that often makes you wonder if it's a bug or working as intended, go get it! I really think that there is a lot of unused potential in this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987494362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 13303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2732, 'last_played': 1689389789}
review:
Brilliant gameplay. I can't recommend the Graviteam Mius Front enough. Probably the most detailed and realistic military sim out there. The AI is strong both on the strategic map and in the tactical battles. 

The dev team seems very committed to quality as well as historical accuracy. Feels the void left by the old Close Combat series and supersedes it both in scope and ambition. 

A bargain at twice the price. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198079621606', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2369, 'last_played': 1709444735}
review:
If you've ever read a book about the eastern front, then you will probably love this game. 

Engagements can start with over a kilometer of open steppe between forces. Machine guns, artillery, and mortars are exactly as effective as you'd think they'd be against exposed infantry half a mile away. Soldiers can be captured, heavy weapons can be recovered, and just like in the real war, there was virtually no anti-air on the steppe.

At times, even when commanding more than a thousand troops, it's funny how Graviteam can get you invested in the fate of three of four forgotten soldiers as their forward trench is slowly overrun.

Bodies, burned out vehicles, and trenches are persistent when revisiting contested map squares, and tanks will deform some terrain types just by passing over them.

The Ui and mechanics are actually fairly simple; that being said, watching a few Warsimmer tutorials on YouTube is absolutely mandatory for enjoying this game. (It doesn't feel like the developers did much to ease the learning curve and prepare to get really frustrated dealing with mine fields)

Overall this game perfectly fills a specific niche of realistic wargame, and no other game in the genre I've played even comes close.

author: {'steamid': '76561198406314570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1654597566}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985086010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 28708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 1790, 'last_played': 1712169378}
review: Достаточно серьезная игра-симулятор  моделирующая общевойсковой бой времен ВМВ -в данном случае театр ВОВ(есть и более поздние конфликты). Формат различных  Тгр с организационно-штатной структурой полков\бригад\батальонов\рот .Повторюсь, единственный и оригинальный варгейм  в своем роде, где упор ставится  на умение организации управление подразделений.  Данный стратегический симулятор имеет два режима, тактический и так в режиме реального времени, где можно лицезреть достаточно качественную и приятную картинку общевойскового боя в масштабе рота-батальон, с симулятивным повреждением техники и изменяемом ландшафтом, под влиянием различных внешних факторов - попадание снаряда в землю, продавливание танком снежного покрова или рыхлой почвой и пр. факт.  При этом каждая кампания имеет нелинейное прохождение.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072056502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 35465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 39, 'playtime_at_review': 603, 'last_played': 1711987371}
review:
LIKE:
Insanely detailed-easy to play (meaning no fast reflexes and 30 actions per minute requred,your troops carry out your orders but do know how to fight, so no micromanaging stuff in middle of fight,you will hop in here and there to give orders but you will have time to enyoy the battle).Graphics,realsim(squads composition,the movement of soldiers,every soldier has its brain and sight,(no borg sharing hivemind),authenticty is everywhere.AI is hit and miss,will reposition,retreat (though rarely) handles its vehicles hauntigly lifelike,but mostly its unimaginative and predictable.Its a beautifull,one-of-a-kind simulator that is easy to play(winning is another thing,that depends on many factors,your knowledge of playing the game,and historical aspect of the operation),atmospheric,realistic,fun(if ww2 realistic fights is your fun dont miss out on this game)

DONT LIKE:
subjective things possibly,sound is boring,sound mods are a must.(they are easy to install)

Its missing tutorials,the UI isnt horrible,but you cant fully apreciate it,and connect it to game mehanics cause there arent enough tutorials and explanations,and examples of game mehanics.There are some youtube tutorials that cover some stuff.Do check The WarSimmer tutorials on youtube.You need a lot of practice with this game to get really efficent with your assets

Also a thing to be remebered that although it looks and behaves very realistic,this is still a game,and not everything can be "perfect"...things are discused often at forums,and developer changes stuff,tweaks things.They even give new operations for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995614971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1304, 'last_played': 1697057027}
review:
Wenn man Nerven aus Stahl hat... (oder die Russen spielt und alles niederwalzen möchte ...) eines der geilsten Hardcore Strategie Spiele überhaupt! ABER, auf deutscher Seite wird man, in den ersten Schlachten der Camp.,  zerstampft, da keine Panzer und Flugabwehr !  Die Inf. könnte auch bessere Panzerabwehrwaffen im Nahbereich gebrauchen. Ich habe gerade 1 h aufgestellt und bin von Fliegern und Artillerie in 30 min. zu 90% zerstampft worden!!!! Ich feiere dieses Spiel, aber das war viel zu heftig, Realismus hin oder her! Zu heftig!!!!
Keinen einzigen, der unglaublich tödlichen Flieger abgeschossen!!! Und die alleine zerstampfen mich zu 70% !!! Wenn schon Flieger hinnein nehmen, dann auch Flugabwehr!!!!! 20cm mal 4 Flak. mindestens!
Sehr geiles Spiel (mit Ruki Sound-mod mega!) sonst, wenn man bereit ist, zu lernen, nerven aus Stahl hat ein unausgeglichenes (realistisches) Spiel zu spielen und Englisch kann. Es gibt sehr gute Englisch sprachige Videos auf YT, zu den Spielmechaniken und Taktiken ec. Ich als alter Strategiespieler, habe auch ein paar Stunden gebraucht, um mich einzufinden, aber dann ein Hochgenuss!!! Was MIR aber fehlt, ist eine, ausgewogene Camp., von mir aus auch eine fiktive Camp.. Camp-Editor währe auch mega, gibt aber nur einen Schlacht- Editor. Wenn ich jetzt auch kritisch wirke, das Spiel ist für die Zielgruppe mega und einzigartig von Spielgefühl her. Strategen mit Können und Willen, werden hier was besonderes finden. "Tank Warfare: Tunesia" ist übgigens aus dem selben Haus, das selbe Spiel, hat aber ein andere Camp. die mm nach etwas ausgewogener ist, hier sind die deutschen zu stark ... :)

Liebes Graveteam, ein paar Verbesserungen z.B. Deutsche Sprache, Camp. Editor ec und ihr habt ein Meisterwerk veredelt...

MfG Brrrruchpilot
