author: {'steamid': '76561198095153552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6305, 'last_played': 1671284873}
review:
Часто вижу, как  люди спрашивают, похожа ли эта игра на "В тылу врага", "Company of Heroes", "Steel Division'44" и т.д. Отвечу категорически - нет ребята ни на миллиметр ни на грамм! У этих игр совершенно ничего общего нет. В Graviteam tactics правят бал суровый реализм и военная тактика. Конечно нынче разработчик практически любой аркады заявляет о реализме, только потому, что там натуралистичная графика, танчики имеют разную толщину брони, а пехота зачатки морали, но этого мало друзья. Graviteam tactics это махровый варгейм, завернутый в красивую обертку Real-Time Strategy, и это обманывает многих, люди часто просто не понимают, что это совсем другая игра и тут все происходит "не так" как в стратегиях потому что это вовсе и не стратегия.  

Так что же такое реализм в этой игре? Ну например честный просчет баллистики каждой пули и каждого снаряда выпущенного на поле боя, влияние ветра и влажности на их поведение (да да, это не шутка), сложный подсчет взаимодействия снаряда и брони, зависящий от дальности, толщины, типа преграды и текущего угла наклона. И это касается не только техники, при взаимодействии с землей снаряды дают разное осколочное поле в зависимости от траектории и мягкости грунта и это тоже обсчитывается динамически. В игре присутствует очень сложная система повреждений техники включающая как навесное оборудование, так и внутреннее, и полученные повреждения на прямую влияют на поведение техники в бою. Важную роль играет мораль бойцов, и меняется она по сложной системе в зависимости от многих факторов, в т.ч. глобальных. Не менее важны в игре и честная физика, разрушаемое окружение, терраформинг: дома рушатся, деревья падают, снаряды оставляют воронки, войска роют окопы, а техника месит грязь, и главное все эти последствия боев остаются на карте в течении всей кампании. Одним словом учтено в игре все, что только можно придумать и даже то, что в голову и вовсе не приходило.
И главное, у всех юнитов в игре есть свой интеллект, и они активно им пользуются при выполнении поставленных задач. В этой игре НЕЛЬЗЯ пытаться накликать юниту что и как он должен делать, тут надо дать ПРАВИЛЬНЫЙ приказ и дождаться его выполнения.

Другие, матерые варгеймщики порой говорят: "У... Да тут нет мультиплеера, нафиг оно надо, с электронным болванчиком играть". Тут я могу ответить только одно: "А ты попробуй". Я пересмотрел уйму видеопрохождений по играм Graviteam и понял для себя одно, уровень тактической грамотности игрового Искусственного Интеллекта заметно выше среднего уровня игроков. Иными словами не каждый человек способен столь грамотно играть как этот ИИ.
В чем это выражается? Именно в алгоритмах действий, ИИ всегда проводит разведку, обходит по флангам, делает отвлекающие удары, ищет слабые места в обороне, активно пользуется артиллерией, выставляет боевое охранение и т.д. Иными словами действует тактически грамотно. Хотя конечно это не уберегает его от ошибок, но такие ошибки присущи и людям. 
Так что мультиплеер это конечно вожделенный элемент игры, для всех поклонников Graviteam tactics, но он и правда не главный тут, т.к. проходить игровые операции и побеждать "электронного таракана" совсем не просто и не скучно. 

В этой игре СОВЕРШЕННО не достаточно просто освоить, не самый простой интерфейс управления, что бы хорошо играть, необходимо иметь хотя бы общие представления о тактике ведения боя, понимать правильные алгоритмы действий и базовые принципы. Без этого нормально играть просто не получится. И именно это отпугивает многих игроков, непонимание происходящего, неправильная оценка ситуации, и недостаточное планирование своих действий приводят к поражениям, и игроки не осознавая собственные ТАКТИЧЕСКИЕ просчеты начинают пенять на "кривую игру", "кривой ИИ", "корявый интерфейс" и т.д. А суть куда проще - надо научится воевать по настоящему. 

Подводя итог можно сказать, что конечно это игра ДАЛЕКО не для всех. Игры подобной Graviteam tactics в принципе и нет, отдаленно напоминают её "Combat Mission" и "Искусство войны", но только издалека. Поэтому если вам не хватает реализма в играх, если вы ищете хардкора, если вам нужна сложная игра над которой придется попотеть, то серия Graviteam tactics для вас, а если вы привыкли побеждать не напрягаясь, и заменять тактическое мышление кликаньем мышки, эта игра вам точно не понравится.

author: {'steamid': '76561198239502490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6164, 'last_played': 1698306140}
review: одна из лучших, может даже просто одна

author: {'steamid': '76561198043338477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3319, 'last_played': 1583094157}
review:
EDIT:  I have since gone through everything i can find with simple searches and finally have a grasp of what this game is trying to do. 

It actually has a lot of detail, a suprising amount really. Another thing is their focus seems to be on realisim, which is what i like. I have found that going through the video tutorials and taking notes, then starting with the smallest campaign, just play expecting everything to go wrong, will force you to learn a lot. Learn about artillery and comunications first, and as you come across major problems search for the anwsers. After that i would suggest printing parts of the manual and even a "Tips for GTOS newbies"

The poor manual could be explained by a simple language difference, and has even been explained by somebody that the company likes people to 'discover' the game for themselves, as part of the fun. I think thats a joke, and as someone else responded thats not a good thing to do when the whole game relys on you making detailed plans to succeed, with components you need to know the capabilities of. My guess is it's just a small company and they dont have the time or resorces to dedicate to english versions.

I have come to really enjoy the game, and admire the attention to detail and realisim. There are some clever features and options, that you'll just have to find out for yourself.. If you're a wargamer, and especially like ww2, in a tactical setting you should give it a chance. Its like a Combat Missions but a little more fluid, is the only word that comes to mind. If you liked CM you gotta try this.
------------------------------------

Whats amazing is how tedious learning this game is going to be, because it doesnt have to be. The tutorials are just stupid. They're lazy and not even thought out, provide very little help if any, and should be an embarrassment. And does this game come with a manual? The only thing i found labeled "gtmf manual" was describing what the icons mean. Basically the manual is something good tooltips do. This sorry ass excuse for a manual, when able to make sense of it, provides very little help understanding the games capabilities and what you can do. ZERO detail is explained about anything going on in the game or under the hood. It's actually something i have never experienced before, am i missing something? Why and how can this happen...
If i find this game to be as shallow as its documentation and tutorials, ill be back to NOT recommend it. As of now it LOOKS fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993401485', 'num_games_owned': 1801, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 2570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1664119358}
review: If you like the Combat Mission series, you will love this game (regardless of it's compact and yet somewhat confusing UI layout.)  This game is worth your money and your time, just make sure that you put effort into learning the controls and how units (especially the arty units and "cable line" units interact with the game.) Overall, I give this game a solid 8/10. There is a lot going on under the hood of this game but the learning curve feels almost like Arma, there is a smally but loyal community/modding base and there are a lot of tutorials out there for how to make this game work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060317472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 18867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6384, 'last_played': 1682357780}
review:
It's one of my favorite games I have ever owned. It's a game that I can kill time with like no other, and still have fun, frustration and udder glee at blowing up an enemy squad or tank. A little rough at first, but clocking in the time into reading on forums and watching playthroughs, I've learned the basics and finished a campaign or two. I recently bought the Tunisia tank warfare game and it's just as fun. I put in over 10 hours within the first two days of buying it. My graviteam experience can be summed up in one battle that I will never forget.

It's early in the offensive. The Russians have blown a hole in our line and we're split off from our counterparts to the north. We've gotten reports of enemy tanks coming in from our left flank. With the two Marder III's, 3, 5cm AT guns, a few 37mm guns and 2, 105mm artillery pieces we have a nice kill zone with infantry slowing any attack made here. Only about 10 minutes into the engagement and I can already hear the enemy tanks. Suddenly out of the fog comes a lone T-34 with infantry on the engine deck. I hold fire on the 5cm until it is within suicidal distances knowing the apcr rounds cannot pen until it reaches a few hundred meters. Finally, I let them fire and in a few rounds the T-34 is dead.       Silence. But now the T-34s have changed direction. The patrol has shown them the kill zone and they're heading straight for my artillery pieces. the fog is now lifting allowing me to see the trees falling in the small creek that is on my flank. Several T-34s come out of the tree line in a column going right for the crossroads objective. My guns hold fire until the first 4-6 can be shot from the flank of my Marders and AT guns. The first T-34 explodes almost immediately. The 105s have killed the first T-34 with their OP Heat shells and now hit the 2nd T-34. It's going well I think.
More guns from the creek open fire revealing 3-4 more T-34s. I'm horrified to say the least with the strength of the enemy forces. Both 105s go down but so do several of the T-34s. The 5cm are doing work on the exposed flanks as well as the 37mm guns surprisingly. The T-34s retreat. A success! But now from my right flank comes even more medium tanks and APCs. My AT guns desperately swing around to fire on them and the infantry do what they can to hamper the advance. The 75mm AT guns I left in the rear are overwhelmed with fire. I move the Marders back but it's too late. I've lost the strength of a few squads and a couple AT guns. 

But at least I didn't lose like 10 tanks in one engagement hehhehehehehehehehehe.
Oh wait. 
It's the russians, they replace their losses in the next turn. OH WELL IT WAS FUN.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041132320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 812, 'last_played': 1542285595}
review: A very well rounded and unforgiving tactical game. Much more user friendly than Operation Star, and better looking graphically. Realistic unit capabilities, communications limitations, and details are all there. For all who loathe micromanaging vast armies of troops as they sweep across the steppes, fear not, because the steamlined orders process will ensure that you can give your units a task, and they will accomplish it to the best of their ability. Morale, suppression, and observation all come into play when you are formulating your plan. AI is generally good, especially the enemy, who will exploit your every mistake and make you pay. If I have any critiques, I have noticed that there are some table of organization issues with some of the units. Not sure if they were omitted intentionally for balance. Also, the tutorials are laughably bad. reference the community guides and YouTube if you are really struggling, but overall this  game is a very enjoyable tactical simulation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006949365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 34500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15142, 'last_played': 1655299108}
review:
Highly recommended:

Well it's early days yet but I would say that this is the most intense and challenging so far. Stacks of units, wide sweeping vistas plenty of scope for flanking movements and tactics.  Considering the quality of the settings and replayability this is well worth the money.

So you are probably guessing that I 'm impressed, yes I am ! I'm not claiming to be a Napoleon butt the AI pulled a flanking movement on me that got me running around like a headless chicken. So five stars from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152464538', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 6982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1055, 'last_played': 1705102558}
review:
'Graviteam Tactics: Mius-Front' ist ein Strategiespiel weches im 2. Weltkrieg angesiedelt ist. Man übernimmt hier die Rolle eines Frontoffiziers wärend einer Schlacht der Heeresgruppe Süd in der UDSSR und lenkt seine Truppen auf taktischer Ebene. 

Das Spiel verwendet die gleiche, wenn auch leicht weiterentwickelte, Engine wie bereits in Graviteams 'Operation Star'. Wer den Vorgänger gespielt hat, der wird sich sofort zurecht finden. 
Neueinsteigern wird es allerdings nicht leicht gemacht. Das Interface ist weder schön noch besonders intuitiv zu bedienen. Ich finde aber es lohnt sich da ein wenig durchzubeißen.

Das Spiel ist in zwei Phasen unterteilt. Auf der Strategiekarte zieht man im Rundenmodus seine Einheiten, verstärkt oder repariert seine Truppen bzw. Fahrzeuge. Hier entscheidet sich auch welche Einheiten aufeinandertreffen und wo es zum Kampf kommt. Dies wird dann in der zweiten Phase ausgefochten. Gefechte werden auf einer schicken 3D Karte in Echtzeit ausgefochten. Wobei sich die Zeit aber auch beschleunigen oder anhalten läßt. Standardmäßig dauert ein Gefecht 60min, dies läßt sich aber auch umstellen.
Die Grafik ist zwar nicht State of the art, aber gut genug um eine tolle Atmosphäre zu verbreiten. Die Ergebnisse und Bewegungen eines Gefechts schlagen sich immer auch auf der Strategiekarte nieder und umgekehrt. 
Abgeschossene Panzer und Granattrichter bleiben auf dem Schlachtfeld liegen und kehrt man an diesen Ort irgendwann zurück, dann findet man dort die Überreste vorangegangener Kämpfe, toll!
Das Game bemüht sich sehr um historische Akkuratesse, was auch gelingt. Die Einheiten sind toll modelliert und man findet wirklich alles an Waffengattungen was eine Armee dieser Zeit eben so bei sich hatte.
Es wird auch alles similiert was man sich so vorstellen kann. Zum Beispiel Kommunikation, Nachschub, Moral, Erschöpfung und Panzerung.
Obwohl die Gefechte in Echtzeit ablaufen, so kommt hier keine echtzeittypische Hektik auf. Das Spiel hat eine sehr langsame ästhetik und bietet einfach viel mehr als Kampf von Blob gegen Blob.

Fazit:
Mir persönlich macht dieses Game sehr viel Spaß. Der Einstieg ist nicht besonders einfach, allerdings auch nicht mehr so schwer wie bei seinen Vorgängern. Mius-Front ist eine echte Empfehlung für alle Hartcore Strategen, ein Muss für jeden Weltkriegs Enthusiast, aber auch für den Casual Gamer eine echte Alternative abseits des Mainstreams.
Das Basisspiel kostet 31,99€€ und bietet eine lange und eine kurze Kampagne, die jeweils auf deutscher und russischer Seite gespielt werden kann.

Für absolute Neulinge dieser Reihe gibt's ein deutsches Tutorial auf meinem Kanal:

https://youtu.be/4cRYJFknLPU

author: {'steamid': '76561197970394510', 'num_games_owned': 1266, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 915, 'last_played': 1490435936}
review: Defending a village, rain of fire coming in, tanks rolling in. Fuchs anti tank gun managed to destroy a tank but panicked when it exploded. The enemy takes over the village, 3 tanks are coming down the valley, my men are scattered all over the map, one enemy tank stays in ambush behind another burning one, can't target it and it's in the center of the village. My men are crawling through the bushes, destroying another tank. They are charged by an infantry man who kills two of them before being taken prisoner. Knebl's crew then rushes over the town center and captures it. The enemy counter attacks. Knebl's crew takes cover from tank fire. Enemy reinforcement in the north are destroyed as they rush through an open field. Fuchs gets back to its canon but is too far away to help, so it's up to the mortar teams to help Knebl's team whose morale is very low. Dinter's team rushes in right after mortar rained death on the battlefield. Last enemy tank is disabled, the others are too far down the valley to come back in time, the day is saved but at what cost? Death, burning corpses, dirt flying in the air when shells hit. This game is amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024648945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1509185871}
review:
Graviteam Tactics Mius Front kann ich leider aus mehreren Gründen nicht empfehlen:

1. Obwohl Deutschland die wichtigste und größte Volkswirtschaft der EU ist und zusammen mit Japan die höchste Dichte von PCs pro Einwohner aufweist, besitzen viele Publisher immer noch die Frechheit Spiele zu veröffentlichen, in denen die Sprache Deutsch einfach nicht unterstützt wird. So leider auch Graviteam. Das ist schonmal ein dickes Minus!

2. Grafik: Die Auflösung lässt sich nicht separat einstellen, sondern wird einfach von der Systemsteuerung übernommen. In meinem Fall nicht gewünscht, da die Einheiten in der autom. Einstellung von 2560 x 1600 auf meinem System viel zu klein und zu "krass" (überdetailiert) sind.

3. Die Steuerung ist ziemlich unübersichtlich und kompliziert. Dafür muss man regelrecht studiert haben - das geht gar nicht! Hier hätte man sich z.B. an der "Combat Mission" Reihe von Battlefront.com orientieren können, die es auch geschafft haben eine angemessene und einfache Steuerung für ein Taktikspiel zu entwickeln.

4. Die Spielgeschwindigkeit lässt sich nicht mehr reduzieren. Im ersten Teil "Operation Star" konnte man die Gamespeed noch runter regeln, jetzt nicht mehr? Ich frage mich wirklich was das soll? Ist das so schwer dem Spieler mal ein paar Optionen zu lassen, damit er nach seiner eigenen Fasson glücklich werden kann? Wenn ich den ganzen Tag schwer gearbeitet habe, bin ich abends müde! Soll ich mich erst noch zwei Stunden hinlegen, damit ich dann wieder fit genug bin um "Mius Front" spielen zu können? 

Leider ist dieser Titel bei mir komplett durchgefallen. Ein PC Spiel soll mir Spaß machen und nicht in Arbeit ausarten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023784793', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 8258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2984, 'last_played': 1704384655}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971467924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1711159835}
review:
For a really long time I have sit on the fence about Graviteam's tactical (or rather, grand tactical) war games (these are NOT RTS! if you are expecting a more realistic Steel Division you will be bouncing back from this one VERY HARD). 

On the one hand, I love the immersion and realism of the maps. They do really bring to life the time and place these battles actually happened. Not to mention the tanks... beautifully modelled and animated. 

On the other hand, the completely unrealistic force sizes in battles (like what is supposedly a division-level assault being led by like three platoons simultaneously over a frontage of 3 kilometers) and weirdness in the UI and the mechanics drove me away. I bought the games because I like the setting, I like that there's people out there crafting games about this period and I appreciate jumping into these battlefields, but not because I enjoyed maneuvering platoons on a battlespace big enough to accomodate a battalion or two.

But something has changed, and oh boy, defnitely for the better. 

Since the release of the British module for their Tunisia game Graviteam has introduced the concept of "battlegroup" at the operational layer... which means that now you can command a battalion (plus supporting armour and artillery) in a battle. Graviteam's efforts at improving the AI and UI now pay off - these very sophisticated formations and SOPs now fit into the context of maneuvering realistically sized, combined arms forces... 

These Ukranian geniuses have brought about the Holy Grail of tactical wargaming. Namely, a game that achieves at the same time, all of the following: a meaningful operational layer like that of Close Combat the Longest Hour, intellectually challenging tactical engagements with realistic orders of battle and, most importantly, plenty of support (by having an AI that can actually can be delegated the minutiae of maneuvering and organising attacks by fire and movement) to manage all these formations so the game is playable and you receive information in a manageable volume and timely fashion.

Right now only two operations (for the Shilovo DLC) have been converted to the Battlegroup system, and I look forward to see progressively the other operations converted too. Play through these, and you will get to experience the most realistic portrayal of World War 2 fighting I have seen on a computer war game. Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060418631', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 8755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1697313128}
review:
[h1]This is the game I've always been waiting for.[/h1]

Finally, Graviteam has catered to new players.


Before this game, I had a love/hate relationship with Graviteam. I tried out their T-72 demo when it came out well over a decade ago, and was disappointed by the amount of bugs.

Last year, I tried their Steel Armor: Blaze of War game, and was frustrated by the strategical and tactical maps, clunky UI and lack of fidelity of the tanks they tried to simulate.

But after trying a lot of strategy games, I was always disappointed by their lack of realism. Rock, paper, scissors may be fun, but history nerds look for something more realistic.

After seeing Agrippa Maxentius' first look video of Graviteam Tactics: Mius Front, I was sold. 

- Beautifully made models
- Amazing animations
- Realistic ballistics and unit capabilities

Too bad I can't show a gif of how the Tiger turret moves and the sound it makes, it's simply stunning.
Same with how men escape their burning tanks, evade the tracer rounds of the enemy and crawl/run/crawl to safety.

It's amazing and shocking all at once, I've never experienced anything quite like it.
You can almost smell the cordite, and feel the pain of the troops.

If you are a history buff: Buy it.
If you like strategy games: Buy it.
If you are looking for a battle simulator: Buy it.

The best tactical game I've ever played. 

There, I've said it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001912496', 'num_games_owned': 1615, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 699, 'last_played': 1615221928}
review:
An excellent progression of the the series begun with the well received, and still played "Achtung Panzer", with new mechanics to make it a little easier in the understanding and implementation of what were oft times confusing mechanics. 

Quite often compared with the Close Combat series from the beginning, as opposed to the TBS "Combat Mission" series (a series I personally never did take to), I'd compare it more with the strategic layer of "Panzer Elite", but that's just me. It is expansive with huge maps and hours and hours of engagements to pass the strategic hours, even with only the base game. 

The graphics are more than serviceable for such a large RTS. It is not "CoH" level, but has the very authentic and peculiar look that all Eastern developed strategy games has - a kind of sandy, grainy look. Not a criticism, more an observation and one that may sway your purchase intent. The attention to detail is second to none, and the unit list is satisfyingly long, and always growing and being tweaked.

If you are drawn into the Graviteam Tactics world as I have been from the start, there are plenty of DLC to fill the library of conflicts for the avid fan to indulge in, from WII on into the 1970's. Can be quite expensive in the long run, so either expect to spend inordinate amounts of hours coming to grips with the game using all of it's many facets. Also with the DLC's, which aren;'t cheap even on sale be prepared to indulge many hours to get your cash investment's worth as it requires the focus that is usually required of "Train Simulator" (a sim with a DLC list soo long, you'll never play it all, or the "DCS" 'study sims'.

TL;DR: If you enjoy WWII (and beyond) strategy titles, that involve huge armour and infantry conflicts, then this is for you. Being an evolution from "Operation Star", if you've played that title you will become very comfortable with the new intuitive mechanics, like the orders wheel and be up and playing in no time. Newbies may wish to watch a YouTube video or three.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021417927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 32478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 446, 'playtime_at_review': 32478, 'last_played': 1712434791}
review:
Practically, This IS an Early Access title.
And by buying this game, you, pretty much, become some kind of patreon, or a kickstarter supporter. The game you see now WILL change dramatically
You might like the next patch, you may not
But the dev's will do whatever they want regardless. Often, without leaving you a way to disable their new "Super realistic" game mechanic.

Its a very weird development practice
You buy a fully released game, but every now and then, dev's will make a patch, that will drastically change the gameplay, turning things up side down. There will be many new bugs and "broken" mechanics. Most of them will be polished out, but then the new patch will show up...

And yet, somehow, the game is a "Full release".
No, its not.
Its an Early Access, or a Work in progress title.
Crude, unpolished and buggy as hell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008796272', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 11440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 593, 'playtime_at_review': 11230, 'last_played': 1712358543}
review:
새로 시작하시는 분들을 위한 몇가지 팁 좀 적어드리고 가겠습니다.


1. 포병은 전장의 신이다

오프맵이던, 온맵이던 간에 포병을 적극적으로 활용하시는 걸 추천 드립니다. 

관측반의 시야가 한치 앞도 안 나오는 것 같아도 300~500m 내에선 효력사까지의 걸리는 시간과 공산오차가 최소로 줄어듭니다

이를 활용하여 공격시 관측반을 적에게 가까이 접근 시켜 빠르고 정확한 포격으로 적의 진지를 부숴야 합니다.

그리고 시야만 잘 확보된다면 아무리 처음 오차가 크더라도 폭발을 보고 정확도가 점점 좋아지기 떄문에

잘 움직이지 않는 대전차포나 박격포 진지를 격파할 떄 아주 효율적입니다.


2. 전차는 그냥 신이다

그라비팀 택틱스에선 관통력이 장갑보다 높다고 해서 바로 뚫리지 않습니다. 세세한 물리엔진을 통해 

탄깨짐, 도탄, 탄 걸림 등의 상태가 있기 때문에, 전차 장갑 관통으로 이어지기 위해선 정 측면이나 후면을 노려야합니다.

반대로 이야기 하자면 아군 측에 전차가 있는 경우, 상대의 대전차포만 잘 정찰해서 박살내주면 사실 그 전투는 이겼다고 볼 수 있습니다. 

하지만 언덕 너머나 수풀 혹은 건물 너머로 갑자기 대전차포가 보이는 경우가 있을 수도 있으니 확실히 정찰하며 박살내는 게 좋습니다.


3. 기습을 활용

시작하자마자 가깝다고 적진으로 달려들거나 싸움에 밀리는 것 같다고 병력을 축차투입하면 좋지 않습니다.

그 대신, 최대한 엎드리고 몸을 숨겨 사격을 중지한 상태로 (Ctrl + Y, Ctrl + G) 적의 동향을 살피거나 순간적인 기습공격을 먹이는 게 훨씬 좋습니다. 왜냐하면 AI가 주로 기동할 때 1~2열 종대로 행군하는 대형을 정말 많이 쓰기 때문에 그렇습니다.

이 부분은 포병이나 전차도 마찬가집니다. 대전차포는 언덕 뒤편이나 길목에서 영거리 사격이 될 정도로 매복 시켜놓고,

포병은 직사 사격을 삼가고 간접 사격으로 필요할 때만 사용하는 게 좋습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994315729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1710154802}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999888759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 2265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1561658916}
review:
I recommend this game, but only just and only to people who are really desperate for a well modeled experience on the eastern front. I've had the most fun when I've avoided infantry as much as possible, especially infantry managed heavy weapons which are literally the most obnoxious things in the game. The tank play is excellent and entertaining to watch, and the air stuff is always impressive even if I have no idea what drives that whole thing. Attacking is hugely fun, especially if you've got halftracks and assault infantry and tanks and artillery observers against an enemy in an entrenched position. 

Defending could not possibly suck more than it does. 

The issues with this franchise (speaking as someone who owns this and Operation Star and has played both) are numerous and severe. 

* Line of fire is impossible to assess without painstaking evaluation using a line tool. Which button engages that tool? Why, the checkerboard over a tank. And you thought that launched the tank checkers minigame! The button next to it which shows a line between a two objects (one of which is a tank)? That's not a line of fire tool silly, that's a totally unrelated vision sectors button which as far as I can tell does basically nothing. Welcome to insanityville. 

* There's also an area of sight tool, but this tool is actually irrelevant to figuring out where units can fire. And so, by the way, is the line of fire tool? Why? Well, line of fire judges ability to fire from the center of the squad, while the game actually checks firing capability at the individual weapon level. As far as the area of sight tool, I have no idea what it is intended to actually show. All I know is that areas will be red even as the line of fire tool indicates they are green for shooting. I'm guessing the game must be modeling broken glasses or severe intoxication on my soldiers because how else can you explain clear line of fire out to 500 yards and area of sight indicating poor visibility beyond 100 yards on a clear effing day?

* Combining cover with the line of fire tool is a great way to drive yourselve absolutely barking mad. 

* Why does this stuff matter? Well, because your soldiers manning critical heavy weapons like machine guns and anti tank guns will abandon most of their ammunition if you ask them to move their weapon somewhere else so that they're able to shoot. This is because the game hates you and wants you to suffer. Enemy tanks charging forward and your tank can't hit them because of some wonky behavior from the game?

* Another annoyance is that the game will indicate an attack is arriving from a particular direction, but the enemy (and player) can deploy and attack from a wholly different sector entirely. This makes a mockery of the defense unless you are that lucky jerk who managed to find the one giant hill in all of Russia and dump all your equipment on it. 

* The menu buttons are totally incomprehensible hieroglyphics with seriously important consequences. I've just come back to the game after a long, long break and clicked on one that immediately dropped me out of a battle to my desktop with zero warning. Apparently this is the "haha i trol u" button. 

I like this game. I tolerate the UI. I play it from time to time. I had an enormous amount of fun with the Soviets vs China Cold War scenarios, and with setting up quick battles between tank forces. Watching Tigers get shattered by T-55s is never not going to be entertaining . And I am always entirely disappointed. Not because the game itself is bad, but because the developers have clearly got so much potential in this franchise and have decided to squirrel it all away from potential adoring with a UI that was clearly made with the goal of causing players to tear out their hair in frustration, and a line of fire system that is equal parts arcane and infuriating.  

I just spent another ten bucks on a DLC that I probably won't ever finish because the frustration of infantry combat will turn me away from this game again. Please, please spend the money hiring people who can fix the atrocious UI and create a more comprehensible set of rules for line of fire. If the developers fixed these issues on this or a future title I'll be happy to personally shower them in money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198390408483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1529053374}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023023915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 335, 'playtime_forever': 1096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1566862525}
review:
There was a huge improvement in the UI, it's far more intuitive and clean than in Operation Star. The units are more responsive to orders. There are several proper tutorials to learn the basics of the game unlike in Operation Star.

However there is still a problem with the gameplay. Its not very clear how to assess the line of sight of your units, what for you is a good firing position its actually a bad position for the unit, this means that you need to check the line of sight of your units one by one. Even in easy mode the game is difficult for no clear reason, some magical bullet will kill your commander, enemy infantry will charge your tanks without problems but your infantry with tank support charging a weak enemy position will enter in panic.  For some reason the tanks cannot fire steadily in what should be a clean shot. You can surprise an AT Unit from behind and for some reason the tank takes a long time to fire in what should be an instant massacre for the enemy.

Battle Map is also confuse, after a battle where you captured territory and where you have lost less troops than the enemy your troops will retreat for no reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998645978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1490901321}
review:
This had the potential for being a great game but fell short because of a few but crucial issues.
I will cut this short , the tutorial and UI is horrible, but that wasnt anything unexpected coming from Operation Star.
The main issue is AI. AI fails to act as normal soldiers in the battlefield conditions, you are going to see lots of instances where you will pull at your hair.
For example, when given an attack command to the infantry ,machine gun section advances alongside them and upon acquiring the enemy targets it waits for about a minute before deciding to open fire. This fire goes on for 15-20 seconds. After that it refuses to fire for another minute doing absolutely nothing and looking at the enemy while getting shot at.
I had high hopes after operation star and the advance of technology after that but only things that improved were graphics.

At its current state i dont recommend it, and i highly doubt AI is something that can be fixed with patches.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993840491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 3819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1705971122}
review:
The Graviteam games are a lot like the Combat Mission games except more intense, more ambitious and if Combat Mission actively wanted you to not know how to play it. Despite that, despite the comparison, there are no other games like the Graviteam games. This game is a SIMULATOR. Very little is abstracted. The issue is that very little is explained; one has to actively work to even get past implementing basic strategies or tactics. The game actually does a lot for you, but it's hard to know when and how that will happen, so you have to guess a lot and many of those guesses will be wrong. And that sounds like it could be a plus for the game, as chaos and uncertainty are necessary elements of emulating the WWII battlefield, right? Except that the uncertainty, the guesses you have to make while not knowing aren't the kind of estimations or hazard guesses that actual commanders would make with minimal info on the ground with their soldiers; instead the guesses the player makes are those of someone who doesn't know what interface iconography means, or what route one takes through the game's interface to order your men to do X or Y. It can be really obnoxious to learn and is inelegant design. The criticisms people have of these games are very valid.

That said, the Graviteam games are still fantastic and impressive pieces of work, you just have to know what you're getting into and be okay with that. The games can require the patience of saint--sometimes you feel like a mother having to tend to an unruly, moody child. But if you're gentle with it and are willing to get shit on your sleaves, actually playing through a campaign can be very rewarding. The folks who made these games have developed a series of unprecendented scope and realism, evocative to the point where even the tedium of military operations bleeds through, and hair-pulling frustrations of trying to get filthy, exhausted individuals to claw through the dirt towards an objective butts right up against the epic feel of maneuvering entire companies of men and tanks across hundreds of miles of terrain. Dozens of tanks and vehicles, hundreds of human beings creeping across hills and valleys, bombed out villages and abanonded defensive positions. Nothing really compares to it. But it takes a long time and you have to be stubborn.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033171571', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 3063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1642916599}

author: {'steamid': '76561197981519856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1495830337}
review: Game would not launch when prompted. Subsequent reinstallation of the game did not remedy the problem. Steam registered the game as running in the background, though there was no instance of the game present in the process list in the task manager. To restart steam and perform trouble shooting measures, steam isteslf must be terminated by way of the task manager process list. Many false hours of play were registered by Steam while troubleshooting the game's failure to launch. Consequently, steam refused to refund the purchase cost of the game due to a balance of more than two (2) hours of play being registered in steam. This may be a great game, but my advice is if it does not work initially, apply for a refund as soon as possible and cease troubleshooting or risk being denied a refund altogether by Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004013869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1590070441}
review:
GT Mius Front, like its predecessor GT Operation Star, is an excellent game for those who like realistic tactical games. It is not a click fest but a game where careful planning and preparation pay dividends.

It does have a learning curve, but I found rather easy to get into. Of course, having success is another matter, but that comes with time and experience.

It has many improvements on GTOS, and particularly, the interface is easier to use. In any case the rewards of playing far outweigh the learning curve, IMHO.

Highly recommended for those who like the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094362003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1527693986}
review:
[spoiler]如果说COH2是RTS界的CF，Wargame是RTS界的战地，MOW是RTS界的红管的话，那这个游戏就相当于RTS界的武装突袭了。 [/spoiler]
从目前刚入手的体验来看，相比于前作OS，MF在很多细节方面更进一步，也基本都保留了前作的优点，教程（稍微）详细了那么一点点， 但有些前作就没解决的问题貌似在MF里还存在，譬如巷战的设定（制作组刻意回避了这一点），短兵相接时的步兵AI，迷一样的高爆弹伤害（手雷在脚下爆炸啥事没有？），步兵没有换弹匣的动画，棒读配音（OS的铁列克提DLC的中文配音严重怀疑是谷歌翻译）。但本作的质量依然是瑕不掩瑜，希望国内的爱好者一起将这个系列推广。
最后希望 Graviteam尽快推出二战后的剧本和武器^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561198011029203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3746, 'last_played': 1705961919}
review:
Although the learning curve is rather steep, the game is enjoyable in all aspects. Mius Front allows me to reminisce about the days of Combat Mission with even more action-packed, t-34 inferno, corpes of the infantry hord, panic striken soldiers, incompetent gun crews, air-power striking, blood curling enjoyment. I only revently bought the game, despite the hours pumped into holding the German front. Enjoy slowing learning the outlay of the land and the capabilities of your forces while the Russians pump infantry, tanks, and artillery down your throat while slowly being pushed back in sectors and defiently holding out against overwhelming forces. If you are looking for a game that is both frustrating and enthralling, Mius Front is your pick. The essence of World War Two as I zoom in on my troops losing commanders and becoming shell shocked is only the beginning of engulfing yourself into the emmense outlay of the terrain and the wooden buildings that hardly provide cover for your troops and are more useful as fire tender. I have yet to complete an entire campaign as I continue to learn the best aspects of my individual pieces of equipment and the valiantly of my troops. You will not be bored.

10/10, would go to 1943 again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110991064', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1685120487}

author: {'steamid': '76561197990750624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1479047339}
review:
Esperava mais. Imaginava algo como um Total War da Segunda Guerra mundial. O que vi foi uma interface muito ruim, difícil de mexer. Difícil de entender. O jogo é amador. Falta fluidez  e uma dinâmica mais clara. 

Gosto do comportamentos dos soldados como no antigo Close Combat, onde se dá uma ordem e a tropa fica com medo e não cumpre, entra em pânico.  Mas neste jogo parece que as ordens não são cumpridas por ser um bug mesmo. Tinha que ter um feedback do que as unidades querem fazer e o que foi pedido, uma interação mais assertiva. As vezes uma ordem simples não é executada, A infantaria se movimenta estranhamente no terreno. As coisas não acontecem da forma como se espera, parece que as unidades ficam travadas e se comportam de forma estranha. 

Minhas frustrações:

Deixei meus soldados próximos do inimigo e nada acontecia. 

Não consegui fazer meu morteiro atirar. 

Os efeitos visuais no terreno não foram bem feitos: Fogo, fumação, buracos.

É necessário investir um tempo só para entender como joga.

A interface é feia, cheia de botões e não é intuitiva.


Quero investir mais algumas horas para tentar mudar esta minha percepção. 
Mas deixo aqui minhas impressões das poucas horas que dediquei ao jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107358521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1105, 'last_played': 1604913017}

-10+ T-34s appear on oppisite ridge 
-accept my fate that i can take a few with me
-first tank burst into flames after direct hit
-continues rolling down hill
-stops only after rolling through fence a shed and part of a house 
-second tank in column is hit and blocks road
-guns destroy two more tanks slowing column 
-rest of column breaks through into village out of my guns line of sight
-soviet infantry cant follow up under the firepower of 5 42's 
-tanks have no choice but to withdraw 
-retreat in column formation 
-lead tank hit spills fuel everywhere and lights woods on fire
-HE shell explodes directly in front of one pak gun=mild heart attack
-crew remans gun
-destory 3 more tanks as they struggle back up the ridge 

-15/10 would beleive in the final victory again 

         The game does require a learning cuve but it is very satisfying when you pull off a victory. Because you cant just recruit new guns or troops with resource or base building it forces you to care about your men and to think your decsions through more than most games. For those coming from Operation Star its still a learnign curve to where it is a newer game but still has the spirit of the original. In my opinion this is how a sequel should be done. 

       If you dont want to take the time to go through learning and are used to always winning agianst stupid A.I. this game may not be for you. It takes time! It will be frustrating and there is no formula for winning. There arent specific counters built into the game and artillery isnt always going to come down where you call it. Its a simulator not an arcade game. And it wont be fair, if you want fair tank on tank combat go play War Thunder Arcade mode! Also if youre expecting a graphically beautiful game dont buy, it has its moments but the animations are clunky and vehicle models do look good but it isnt BF1. 

      What the game sets out to do it achieves. And that is a realistic depiction of small/medium unit engagements in WW2. Not for everyone but if you take the time then it will grow on you and you'll never go back to other strategy games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084564601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 66118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 990, 'last_played': 1688897853}
review:
As an older gamer in his mid fifties who is obsessed with WW2 and especially the Eastern Front, this game is a dream come true. So far with only 16 hours in I am still on the steep learning curve as to how to do things but, that said, with every hour played and with helpful tutorials, especially on You Tube, even those for the earlier Graviteam game  Operation Star, I am understanding more. With this understanding you realise just what depth and knowledge this game has to offer, There is a saying that the Devil is in the details and there is one huge Devil in this game. The Binocular and magnifying glass view of your tanks taking AT fire, of hits and brewing vehicles with molten steel sparking high into the air as ammo cooks off makes the game worth the price alone. The inclusion of German and Russian as the language being shouted by the soldiers adds to the historical depth that runs through the veins of the programming that has been lovingly coded into this creation.
        I could go on for many paragraphs about the attention to detail here but suffice to say, having a library of over 300 books just on the Eastern Front alone, Mius Front beats the oppositon in so many ways showing the War in that theatre of operations. Get over your concern about how to actually cope with all the menus and control options as they will make sense over time. I am still learning and will be for a few days if not weeks but who cares. Buy this game and Operation Star and a smile as wide as the Russian front will appear on your face.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024818971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1499629959}
review:
Extremely lacking in content. I managed to learn how to play (really wasnt that hard as somebody experienced with complex WWII strategy games), and had a blast. Then I realized how empty this game truly is. The base game has 1 map...ONE. Okay so thats not so bad considering the size I suppose. Then I went to try and change the settings to make a custom battle take place in winter since of course, this game takes place in fucking Russia, right? WRONG. You can not get a single drop of snow on the ground in this game. You can make it winter, you can make there be a blizzard with snow blowing around, yet the grass will remain green as a hot July day, even though tanks will have winter camo, and trenches will be white as if they were dug out of snow. Thought something was wrong, so I check the community hub. The Dev comes off as an absolute moron. They say "Well people didn't like snow in GTOS so we completely removed it from Mius Front. The game is exlusively set in the summer" Which is just an absurd thing. I could understand this quote a little better, if there wasn't an option to fucking set the battles in the winter, and change infantry camo to winter, only to have it do absolutely NOTHING. 

Its a joke of a game, really. I'm fortunate enough that this was gifted to me for Christmas, but I feel bad that the money was wasted. This game is NOT worth $35, it is NOT worth the sale price of $22.74, and it would not even be worth $15. I would say this game is worth $5-$10 TOPS. It is an overpriced P.O.S. completely lacking in content. It will be fun at first, but once you get the hang of things, you realize how awful this is. If you want to get into it, get Operation Star. That game is also lacking in content, but the price during the sale is very reasonable. This game however, is a joke. Please do not buy it for more than $10. I wish I learned sooner how much of a steaming pile of shit this is, so I could've taken it off my wishlist.

*I do not care if there are more maps in any sort of DLC. The point remains that you still can not get any snow on the ground, and everything is locked to a summer theme. I will not be investing any more money into this garbage unless it was some sort of snow map, which sounds ridiculous. Why should I have to pay extra to get snow in a setting that is known for its harsh winters and heavy snowfall?*

author: {'steamid': '76561198021236261', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 7380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3026, 'last_played': 1710696160}
review:
Пожалуй, самая реалистичная стратегия из всех, что я видел.

Плюсы:
Маленькая цена.
Это игра-фильм, можно выключить интерфейс и наблюдать за боем с кружкой чая.
Умный ИИ, который иногда выдаёт очень подлые и хитрые вещи(а иногда тупит, не без этого, да).
Графика вполне годная, звуки отличные, а физика - главная фишка игры. Игра сделана на движке танкового симулятора(Steel Fury: Kharkov 1942), соответственно танковые бои в ней очень зрелищные и реалистичные.
Массовость битв(в одном бою могут быть сотни пехотинцев и десятки танков)
Редактор миссий
Реалистичная система командования, боевого духа, видимости.
Разрушаемость. Остаются воронки в земле, которые пехота использует, как укрытие. Можно разрушать дома.

Минусы:
Отсутствует мультиплеер, хотя обещали его прикрутить.
Присутствуют мелкие баги и недоработки, но разработчики их постоянно фиксят.
Игра очень сложная для освоения новичками. Любители аркадных игр, в которых разработчики вас ведут за ручку, идут мимо.
Скудное кол-во техники, мб в ДЛС добавят больше.
Плохая анимация у пехоты, иногда, она мешает пехоте проявить себя в бою.

Пожалуй, всё. 
Однозначно рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198250549208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 24019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6451, 'last_played': 1586807011}
review:
Where to begin?

A wonderful piece of software, made with passion and expertise by a developer that knows the subject matter and strives to recreate the grim reality of commanding men on the field of battle.

This is not a wargame, neither is it an RTS, it's a coldly unforgiving battle simulator that does a terrific job of placing the player in the shoes of a battalion commander, this is a game where actual knowledge and understanding of military doctrine and of the tools at yours and your enemies disposal will be advantageous, real world tactics not only work but are necessary in order to succeed.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list][*]Historical accuracy.
[*]Level of detail is mind blowing, every weapon with all their various types of ordinance behave accordingly. Artillery craters, dead troops and wrecked vehicles/guns from previous engagements litter the battlefield. Fuel and ammo stores are based upon contemporary sources. Artillery strikes must be ranged for effectiveness and fuses can be set for air burst. Line of sight for every single combatant is factored in, including from tank driver periscopes and turret slits. On map artillery and mortars require a commander to have eyes on the target area and lines of communication must be open before they can be properly utilized. Flares can be used to illuminate the night sky, coloured flares and smoke signal the direction of enemy forces among other things. Tank crews repair broken tracks, as tanks burn paint blisters and peels off the surface, ammo stores cook off, fuel tanks explode, when an AT shell strikes a tank it may penentrate depending upon the thickness of the armour plate and the angle of impact etc, the shell may exit harmlessly or bounce around inside, it may remain in tact or break up, if it breaks up what happens to the fragments? do they destroy/damage the crew? the weapon systems? it's all simulated and the story of each impacting projectile can be reviewed and studied after the battle ends, the list it goes on and on... 
[*]Visually beautiful and extremely atmospheric.
[*]Vast and topographically accurate battlefields with deformable terrain, buildings crumble, fences collapse and trees shed their leaves when rocked by a passing tank or concussed by exploding ordinance.
[*]Excellent operational phase with many campaign management features.
[*]Astonishing focus on realism. Ballistics, damage modelling, troop morale, experience levels, resupply, movement, command and communications systems, ambient factors such as dust, smoke, rain, mud, fog and darkness are all accurately simulated and have appropriate impact upon events and units ability to function.
[*]Literally 1000's of modifiable commands.
[*]Constantly being patched, improved and refined, active developers who engage (mostly) in a positive way with the community, several times I have seen players post a bug report on the forums only for a patch fixing the issue to appear within hours.
[*]Intelligent DLC policy, entire campaigns at fair prices.
[*]Unscripted AI which means almost endless replayability.
[*]Great battle editor with many tools for influencing AI behaviour, which extends replayability even further.
[*]Ability to import/export campaign and custom made battles to and from the community, increasing replayability further still!
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1][list]
[*]For new players to the series there is a learning curve (although personally that almost qualifies as a pro).
[*]AI can be derpy (but is also capable of astounding and confounding even the best players).
[*]New tactical map system is not to my taste.
[*]Infantry skins are well below the high standard of the vehicles, however Nightpostman's skin mod soon fixes this.
[*]No multiplayer (although it may make an appearance sometime in the future).
[/list]

Look, we are talking about a very small independent developer with other projects on the go, this masterpiece, this labour of love represents a truly staggering achievement, which frankly puts the paltry offerings of many so called 'Triple A' studios with their multi million dollar budgets to shame.

If you are interested in military based strategy and fancy yourself as a master tactician then look no further, there is no better or more satisfying challenge out there.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198023535857', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3937, 'last_played': 1697781480}
review:
忙しい操作が苦手な人におすすめです

ゲームというかシミュレーターなのでびっくりするほどT-34が砲弾を跳ね返してドイツ軍プレイヤーに絶望を味あわせてくれます
また戦闘終了時にはユニットの状態などを確認できるのでお気に入りの部隊がどれだけ戦ったかとかを眺められます

初期状態では4キャンペーン(ドイツ軍/ソ連軍）で主にソ連軍が攻勢側です
キャンペーンはDLC購入で増えていきます、前作のGraviteam Tactics:Operation Starでは最終的にDLCで1988年までの戦闘が体験できました

BattleEditerもついているので大戦車戦も可能

日本語非対応

author: {'steamid': '76561198001015011', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 3677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2090, 'last_played': 1682259512}
review:
(Very) good games are pretty rare nowadays, especially for PC gamers. I have been looking a long time for a game that can hold my attention span for more than 10-20 hours. Few games could, like Fallout: New Vegas, Diablo 3, CoH2 and some others. Lately I’ve rather been collecting games instead of playing them like many others on Steam. Just playing them for a few hours and thinking “no, this is not it…” and ending up with 1.5 – 10 hours played and already getting bored. So which game could pull me in for more than at least 200 hours?

When Graviteam Tactics: Mius Front came out I already played around 10 hours on Graviteam Tactics: Operation Star. The controls, the confusion about what’s going on, the lack of a good tutorial, it all added to putting the game down and thinking: “Nice game, but I’m gonna try a few others first”. But when GT:MF came out, I immediately bought it. I guess something in my unconscious, said: “Buy it. Just buy it! And give it another try!” It still took a few months, but after being disappointed by another bunch of games, I started GT:MF, and this time with the determination to not let go before I got the hang of it.

And after another 15-20 hours, it struck me thinking: there is absolutely no equivalent to this game when you like RTS war games. GT:MF (and also GT:OS) will leave you speechless. If and only if you persevere the first few hours playing this game. And with “first few” I probably mean the first 100 hours and more. It is so much more than a RTS game, it is a real battlefield simulator. And a damn good one too! Don’t rely on the fact that when you issue orders, your soldiers will simply obey them. If your commander is too far away and you don’t have telephone and wire cables set up, your orders will not be transferred among other things.

GT:MF is no click-fest like most other RTS games with intense micro management. No, it focuses on careful planning, creating strategies, coordinating combined forces of infantry, cavalry and anti-tank units, setting up defenses, entrenchments, fire archs, calling in air strikes or artillery, which shells to use, reinforcing units, line of sight etc, etc, etc. Everything is done during three phases: the strategic, the deployment and the operational phase.
Replenished your units and carefully planned your defenses during the strategic and deployment phase? Well, you can bet the AI will try to circumvent you and attack from completely other directions you thought they would attack. When you thought they only had a few tanks, suddenly there are ten T34’s crushing your only three PAK’s you set up in the villages of Marinovka or Stepanovka. Key points can switch hands multiple times during the campaign.

Because the campaign is long! Very long! I only played part of the Marinovka – Stepanovka campaign as Germans and I am still playing it. After reinforcing my units at strategic phase Turn 1, the Soviets attacked my positions from… Well, almost f****** everywhere!  All these battles you have to fight before you can replenish your troops and start Turn 2. I played for 20 hours now and I am still in Turn 2. No campaign will be the same, so the amount of replayability is huge!
GT developers made it possible to transfer your units under AI command and I must admit, I do that a lot. But when the Russians come too close I take over command. But the AI is smart and you can sometimes sit back, relax and watch all hell break loose. Most of the time I use the “helicopter view” to direct my troops, but when you zoom in, the physics of the explosions and hits are so good. I always zoom in after the battle to see the statistics and devastation on the battlefield. You can watch the statistics to see which hit did most damage and which hit knocked out that tank or PAK or whatever. Which brings me to the level of detail.

The game is so insanely detailed: everything is carefully crafted and added to the game: weapons, calibers, tanks, anti-tank, artillery, armour penetration diagrams (ridiculously detailed), ammunition, morale, command level etc, etc, etc. If you’re a World War 2 / history fanatic like me then this is definitely a (no, THE) game for you.

Another thing to mention are the carefully crafted environments and staff maps. Heights play an important role and you better plan your strategies based on these on the information on these staff maps. It is all there on the maps: the gullies, hills, rivers, woods, farms, bridges. I immediately believe it if they say it is exactly the same as it was in 1943. The surroundings, the atmosphere, the tension during night battles with tracers flying everywhere. Man, this is a tactical wargame! Nothing comes close and all other wargames are redundant / unessential for me now. I am not saying other RTS war games are rubbish but no game can ever live up to the standards of this one for me.

DLC will bring you new campaigns and I just bought Dawn of Blau as well as a few other expansions for GT:OS (some depict the Afghanistan campaign and one does the conflict in Angola bringing you new tanks and units). Do I need it right now? No, but the DLC for GT:OS is sometimes on sale like it was this weekend. Was the DLC for GT:MF also for sale? No, but these developers deserve my money for this one. This is the game I was looking for to sink more than 200 hours in. And I will!

Most of the stuff I found out myself. But if you’re stuck or confused (and you will get stuck or get confused in the beginning) there are plenty of good tutorials on YouTube. I recommend the tutorials from Arch Warhammer or Agrippa Maxentius. They explain a lot and it’s worth to put some time into watching these videos as they make it a lot easier to get into the game. Be as tenacious as the Germans or the Soviets in this game and you will be rewarded with some very memorable moments. After twenty hours I can’t count them anymore as I won and lost various battles but each and everyone of these battles had it’s share of the finest moments in my overall gaming experience.

I am still confused about some partsof the game: buttons, movements by the AI, artillery strikes off target although I planned it carefully, replenishment of troops and lots and lots of other things. But never ever has an RTS game with a slow pace given me so much excitement and joy. It keeps me on the edge of my seat and I found myself sometimes staring at the screen whispering: “Take out that bloody T34, for heavens sake!”

Totally and highly recommended! I can not praise this game / these games and the developers enough! I already collected some medals during battles but if there was one with the Order of the Ukraine, it should be pinned on the chests of these wonderful men and / or women of this game studio. You deserve it!

10/10 Masterpiece

author: {'steamid': '76561198021089821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1652058827}
review:
Tatical combat simulator (real time) where you watch history recreated in a virtual reality.

its fun, battles are engaging and graphics are up to modern stanards.

Music is meh, but i listen to sabaton while playing so :^)

Get this game, its fun, you'll enjoy and appreciate the complexity, and depth this strategy game has to offer. 

8.7/10 Needs ai tweaking, but updates are almost weekly, support these devs they made a truly amazing ww2 simulation, and most importantly...made a FUN ww2 game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039601740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 26744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7398, 'last_played': 1636653709}
review:
Yeni bir oyun türü bile denebilir bu oyun için. Taktik savaş simülasyonu en iyi türkçe açıklama. Uzun planlama aşamalarından sonra tam bir görsel ziyafet. 

Oyun Total war serilerinin oynanışını getiriyor. Turn based bir stratejik harita üzerinden birliklerinizi yerleştirip saldırılarınızı planlıyorsunuz. Karşı tarafın hareketlerinden sonra çatışmaları oynuyorsunuz. 

Sıradan bir sivilin modern savaş mantığına en çok yaklaştığı oyun. 

Strateji oyunu arıyorsan ve bunu okuyorsan çok doğru bir karar vermek üzeresin dostum.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990605553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 58248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16807, 'last_played': 1703952041}
review: Amazing game. I'm addicted !

author: {'steamid': '76561197993272164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1476719035}
review:
I feel that this is a nice game, but not the gem it could be.

Controls and UI are a bit hard to grasp. Actual impact on your actions once a scenario starts are minimal. So much is pure chance and it's quite oftan just an interesting simulation playing out without your input.

I still haven't had efficient onboard artiellery fire more than two shells at what I actually wanted.

Recommend this becasue if you like this type of game, this is a good one. I'd recommend demoing first if possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022951093', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1477314611}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008258393', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 1327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 969, 'last_played': 1666810869}
review:
Juego o simulador, puede ser las dos cosas ya que trae las dos opciones, tiene campañas que constan de una serie de misiones y un editor en el que crear tus propias batallas seleccionando la veteranía y moral de las unidades, la hora de la batalla, el clima y la duración (30min, 1h, 2h y 3h).

Las armas tienen alcance realista, por lo que ha sido necesario crear mapas enormes llegando a haber mapas con 80km y 140km que se han echo al detalle, esto ha impedido que se hagan muchos mapas por lo que se dispone de muy pocos.

Hay una gran cantidad de unidades, infantería a pié, motorizada, mecanizada, etc. contando cada una con variantes de reconocimiento, asalto, apoyo, etc., la mayoría los vehículos están disponibles en varias versiones, así observamos que el Sdkfz alemán tiene la variante de transporte de tropas, fuego de apoyo (con un mortero)  y muchas más.

Lo malo, terriblemente gran fallo por lo que no lo recomiendo, es que la Inteligencia artificial se rinde cuando quiere (cuando la batalla va un poco mal o ve que tus fuerzas son superiores) y se acaba la batalla sin que puedas decidir; muchas veces se rinde tras los primeros disparos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998167405', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 65226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54282, 'last_played': 1688735695}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040125212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 13245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5499, 'last_played': 1646204080}

author: {'steamid': '76561198088932500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 13345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1710982333}
review:
There is simply no analogue to this game on the market right now. As slow-paced and complicated as it is, every battle is unique, leading to high replayability and memorable moments. Developers continuously support it by improving the gameplay and creating new content. 

Definitely not for everyone, but if you are looking for a realistic and immersive WW2 strategy game, you should give it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084722020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 785, 'last_played': 1689410404}
review: Absolutely the best wargame out there!!! Hard to master but once you get the hang of it your in for one **** of a ride, I gave up at first but once I came back and gave it a chance I love it. Its not your normal RTS every move has a negative and positive outcome, Artillary is terrifying or your best freind same goes with trenches. There is nothing better than having thinking you have set up a great defensive strategy only to find out 20 minutes in you didnt take into account one of your flanks is weak and their infantry sneak up to your pak guns and destroys 2 of your 3 and then you have to scramble to attempt to secure the flank with a unit that has low ammo and taken heavy losses and all other units are heavily engaged. Every loss and victory have atleast 2 memorable moments in that conflict and I say atleast 2 because every burning hulk of metal or fallen soldiers has a story that cannot be recreated in any other game just look at all the screenshots. After the battle you can look at the battlefield and see the carnage that I have never seen in any other game that can depict a battle that was never scripted. No campaign will play the same. I really dont have to many negatives besides sometimes the AI can act kind of funny but overall it does a very good job. I think other companies need to take a look at this and realize there are some of us still out there that dont enjoy the mindless click fests that most games are becoming. So thank you Graviteam for such a great game that we can lose hours into and I absolutely recommend this game to anyone who is sick of the click fests and enjoy actual strategy and thought and REALISM.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985500605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2164, 'last_played': 1548420734}
review:
Поиграв определенное время, пришел к следующим выводам, плюсы данной игры можно перечислять довольно долго, т.к. их действительно много, поэтому напишу то, что является проблемными сторонами.
1)Управления и освоение игры, для меня в данной серии игра была первой, и прежде чем получать удовольствие и азарт от процесса, понадобилось потратить часов 7-10, чтобы полноценно вникнуть в то что происходит.Поэтому если вы собрались брать эту игру, не важно каким опытным игроком вы являетесь и в какие стратегии вы играли до этого. Игра хардкорная во всех смыслах этого слова, для меня это плюс, но если вы не готовы заморачиваться в серьез, то лучше отложить идею покупки.
2)Оптимизация игры и настройки, не могу сказать ,что с этим плохо,просто нужно поиграть с настройками чуть больше чем обычно, тогда фпс будут вас устраивать. Ресурсов вроде жрет много, а графика ну не прям ах, для меня это второстепенно опять же, но если люди хотят получить максимально красивую картинку, то стоит обратить внимание на способности вашего железа.
(из мелочей,пару раз багало воздушные юниты при падении, они просто зависали в 50 метрах над землей)
3)Некоторое однообразие компании и видов войск, т.к. в игре затронут довольно короткий промежуток времени, то и техника преобладает соотвествующая и выбор её не зашкаливающий, тоже самое касается событий компании в целом. Игра примечательна в первую очередь, возможностями во время боя и максимальной приближенности к реалиям (не припомню аналогичных игр), поэтому для фанатов хардкора и историчности, думаю игра подойдет наверняка, а если для вас приоритетна веселая и уютная игра с разнообразием, то лучше опять же поискать что-то другое.

Ну а так, в общем и целом в данном жанре игра 9.5 из 10 на мой взгляд)

author: {'steamid': '76561198045799799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1525221676}
review:
Le meilleur jeu tactique et de Stratégie que j'ai jouer!
J'adore tous les détailles du réalisme!

Je n'ai pas tellement d'heure de jeu sur Mius Front, mais j'ai jouer de nombreuses heures à Operation Star.
Je peux donc vous confirmer qu'on en a pour son argent.

C'est le premier jeu de strategie où que chaque bataille compte réellement, chaque munitions doivent être dépenser stratégiquement, chaque véhicule endommagé peuvent être perdu pendant plusieurs combat pour réparation, le positionnement de chaque Platoon est extrêmement important, les tanks ont une valeur si importante que chaque perte est difficile, ce pourquoi il ne faut jamais attaquer une zone sans quelques éclaireurs pour éviter de mauvaise surprise.

Tellement de chose à dire sur ce jeu.
Acheter sans hésiter!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033928937', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 36981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1586, 'last_played': 1710530412}
