author: {'steamid': '76561197990701022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 12111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1710248012}
review:
EDIT: With a recent patch my game can now finally start and run fine. I know it seems a bit wrong to criticize a game that wouldn't run one moment but did the next, but when a dev tells you to seek a refund that definitely means the end of the road in most cases.

So the game works fine now. I've spent a few hours playing it, and I've played a fair bit of Operation Star as well, but it still feels like just scratching the surface. The gameplay is terribly deep, and along with that depth there come a lot of confusing mechanics and questionable player friendliness. However, this is a completely unique strategy game. More a simulation than anything, it's a gorgeous attempt at recreating the tactics and difficulties of combat in Eastern Ukraine, Summer 1943.

It's difficult, it's infuriating, it's opaque, and it won't even do a good job of telling you if what you're doing is working. In short, it's combat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155559923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2157, 'last_played': 1570651686}
review:
I played the game for couple of hours and have some conclusions:

1. It is good combination of operational and tactical level simulator. Operational level is simple but allows player to control what is happening. Almost... There is a limit on how big map can be played and how many units take part in battle. This is major flaw.
2. AI is good but need some tweaking. Tanks turning side or back to AT gun is a common sight.
3. Campaign is demanding. You have to plan good and execute combined arms tactics.
4. There is huge imbalance in armor capabilities. Marders are roaring battlefield indestructible. This is damn annoying as it is well known fact that these machines were mostly used in ambush not as tanks! KV-1 vs Marder do not stand a chance. Marder vs 45mm AT gun will win in most cases.
5. KV-1 generally is weak. When dueling medium AT gun it will be certainly destroyed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022087017', 'num_games_owned': 789, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1702157602}
review:
"Graviteam Tactics: Mius Front". Hinter diesem eigenwilligen Namen verbirgt sich nichts geringeres, als der neueste Teil der packenden "Achtung Panzer" Reihe. Vor rund drei Jahren wurde die Serie ja in Graviteam Tactics umbenannt. Ob das auf das Ego der ukrainischen Entwicklers Graviteam zurück zu führen ist, oder gegebenenfalls urheberrechtliche Gründe hat, vermag ich nicht genau zu sagen. Ich meine aber einmal gelesen zu haben, das Paradox Interactive - einer der letzten Publisher der Serie - irgendeinen Zusatz im kleingedruckten verankert hatte und nun die Rechte an dem alten Seriennamen hat...

Auf das Spiel selbst möchte ich gar nicht im Detail eingehen. Hier empfehle ich mein Test zum Vorgänger: http://www.7idgaming.de/content.php?140-Matrix-Games-Achtung-Panzer-Operation-Star-REVIEW .

Das Spielprinzip ist gleich geblieben. Verbessert hingegen hat sich in der Tat die Steuerung und das Interface. Ich würde nicht so weit gehen und behaupten, dass es nun Optimal und super Einsteigerfreundlich ist, nein. Aber ich würde nun doch behaupten, dass man relativ schnell damit zurecht kommt.

Von den Kampagnen selber hätte ich mir etwas mehr gewünscht. Mit wäre es lieber gewesen, sie wären länger ausgefallen als bei "Operation Star". Bei Mius-Front stehen je zwei Deutsche und zwei Sowjetische Kampagnen zur Auswahl. Die kürzere deutsche Kampagne dürfte man in rund 10 Spielstunden beendet haben. Die längere in vielleicht 25 Stunden. 

Zum geschichtlichen Hintergrund zitiere ich ganz einfach den offiziellen Wikipedia Eintrag dazu: "Die Donez-Mius-Offensive war eine sowjetische militärische Operation während des Zweiten Weltkrieges an der deutsch-sowjetischen Front. In ihrem Verlauf kam es zwischen dem 17. Juli und dem 2. August 1943 zu größeren Kämpfen zwischen der Roten Armee und der Wehrmacht an den Flüssen Donez und Mius. Das Ziel der sowjetischen Südwest- und Südfront war, die deutsche Führung zum Abzug von Verbänden des Unternehmens Zitadelle bei Kursk zu zwingen und das wirtschaftlich bedeutende Donezbecken zurückzuerobern. Nach geringen Anfangserfolgen gelang es der deutschen Heeresgruppe Süd jedoch, die sowjetische Offensive aufzufangen und stellenweise die alte Frontlinie wiederherzustellen."

Neben dem verbesserten Interface bietet sich das Spiel auch deswegen für Neueinsteiger in die Serie besonders an, weil man als Deutscher hauptsächlich in der Verteidigung ist und sich auf einigen leichten Anhöhen relativ gut eingraben kann. So kann man sich Schritt für Schritt in die Feinheiten des Spiels einarbeiten und zudem die herrliche Schlachtenatmosphäre genießen, die schlichtweg gesagt nach wie vor ihresgleichen sucht. Kein anderes Strategiespiel kann der Serie hier das Wasser reichen.

Das Geschehen auf dem Schlachtfeld hatte sogar neulich meine Frau dazu bewegt, sich staunend neben meinem Monitor nieder zu lassen und das ganze zu beobachten, anstatt über die dröhnende Lautstärke des Schlachtgetümmels zu wettern. Leuchtspur, Granateneinschläge und Verzweiflung auf einer Frontlänge von drei Kilometern sage ich da nur...

Als Neueinsteiger ist das durcharbeiten der einzelnen Tutorials, die unter "Quick Battles" zu finden sind, ein Muß. Auf "Surprise me" und "Meeting Engagement" könnt ihr aber verzichten. Plant hier einmal zwei Stunden für ein. Die Tutorials sind leider gewöhnungsbedürftig. Manchmal dachte ich, es geht nicht weiter. Es zieht sich einfach etwas, also nicht nervös werden. Habt ihr diese durch, solltet ihr in der Lage sein, wenigstens eure Truppen auf dem Feld vernünftig einzusetzen. Den Umgang mit den Truppen auf der Strategischen Karte sowie deren Management (Reserve, Ersatz etc.) über die Einheits- und Divisionslisten werden jedoch kaum verständlich gemacht. Das kommt aber mit der Zeit, keine Sorge.

Weiterer kleiner Wehrmutstropfen ist das fehlen eines Multiplayers. Die Serie würde sich ja geradezu anbieten dafür. Aber was nicht ist, kann ja noch kommen. Also. Wer wirklich Lust auf epische und packende Weltkriegsgefechte hat, sollte hier zuschlagen. Mius Front könnt ihr bis zum 04. Juli noch für 22,39 € erwerben. Danach kostet der Titel wieder 31,99 €. So oder so ist das Spiel den geforderten Betrag wert. Der Vorgängertitel "Operation Star" kostet im Sale derzeit sogar nur rund 4 €. Aber Vorsicht! Hier ist aufgrund des Interface mit anfänglichem Frustfaktor zu rechnen. Greift lieber gleich zum neuen Teil.

Meinen kompletten Test gibts hier: http://www.7idgaming.de/content.php?262-Graviteam-Tactics-Mius-Front

P.S. 
Bin bei Steam auch als Kurator unterwegs und freue mich über jeden Follower: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/2370797-7IDGaming.de/?appid=275290

author: {'steamid': '76561198032914734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1467643911}
review:
I've never played a 'Graviteam'  made game before, so I'm totally unfamiliar with this developer. I have played Battlefront published games like the original Combat Mission series from 15 years ago or so. This game is somewhat comparable in style, however it is more or less a live action game after the pieces are set. This is not a RTS type of game like Company of Heroes, it's really a battlefield simulator with a God's eye view of everything and the ability to pause and speed up. 

Unfortunately, the developer sort of dumps you straight into a main menu with a couple of large scenarios right off the bat. If you're inexperienced, don't try to play these, use the quick battle option and you will find several tutorial type of scenarios to run. These are extremely sensitive to deviation from the instructions. If you misunderstand an instruction or click the wrong button, you will probably have to start it over again to complete it. Fortunately, these scenarios are small enough to avoid overwhelming a new player.

The game interface is quite difficult to understand and the overall presentation is not well thought out. However it is configurable and if you're willing to spend some time watching experienced players play this game on Youtube, it is not an insurmountable task to get to a point where you find it playable. 

The sound quality is fair, but not great, I get a bit of popping and crackling with button clicks and other actions that is annoying with headphones on. The music is awful and I had to turn it off within minutes of playing my first scenario. The graphics would have been cutting edge 10 years ago; today they are passable.

The game play is actually quite fun. There is a setup phase, then a battle phase. The setup of your forces is a bit simplified, however there is a decent amount of complexity and you can do an adequate level of fine tuning of positions. The line of site tool is extremely valuable, especially during the deployment phase.

Once the battle begins, your task is mainly scanning your God's eye around the battlefield and prioritizing targets or adjusting force maneuvers/positions. You never control anything directly; you can issue orders. There is a great deal of complexity and some battles are so large, that micromanagement would make the game too tedious. 

If you're looking for a good WWII battlefield simulation with lots of complexity and accuracy to details, you will like this. This is not the type of game most would enjoy or take the time to understand, but as a war gaming veteran, I am enjoying it.

review:
to be honest, i was pretty worried. operation star set the bar very high for anything that would call itself a sequel.

it's great though. the scale is bigger, it's prettier, the sounds are much better in general, and the core experience of horrible gruesome eastern front warfare is still entirely intact.

a worthy sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021480672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 13155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9400, 'last_played': 1635724305}
review:
За давностью лет первого обзора, переписываю его полностью.

Начну с плюсов по игре:
- графика - в игре она со временем похорошела и теперь смотрится приятно
- поведение техники - лучшее среди стратегий, очень натуралистично
- тактическая симуляция военных действий - бесподобная, хоть далеко и не идеальная
- стратегический менеджмент - многократно увеличивает реиграбельность
- разрушаемость и терраморфинг - придают баталиям реалистичности
- поведение ИИ - лучшее среди стратегий, хотя и не без досадных ляпов
- есть энциклопедия, в которой можно поразглядывать технику, сопоставить её масштаб, ознакомиться с ТТХ, посмотреть графики бронепробития и устойчивости брони
- редактор, в котором можно составить схему боя и протестировать разный состав войск, сам по себе является мини игрой
- зрелищность и атмосфера. Боевые действия хорошо воспроизводит атмосферу войны. Ловишь себя на мысли о том, что игра способна показать нечто настоящее ... что вот так примерно всё и было ...  Смотря на печальную картину разнесенных в клочья своих отделений, которые так долго и с надеждой на победу расставлял в поле, ощущаешь ничтожность отдельной человеческой жизни ... 

Ни то, ни сё:
- звук, в игре как бы есть, но всё же он не достаточен для полного погружения в бой. Не хватает музыкальных военных маршей, объемной звуковой картины боя, исторических и натуральных разнообразных звуков. Мододелы пытались поправить ситуацию со звуком при помощи модов, но в целом это не сильно улучшило картину

Минусы:
- обучение. После прохождения внутриигрового обучения, вам придётся изучать мануал по игре, потом снова проходить обучение и параллельно повторять мануал. И так не один раз и всё равно нельзя будет понять некоторых особенностей игры. К слову, я наиграл 140 часов и до этого еще 50 часов в предыдущую часть игровой серии, и всё-равно некоторые моменты я недопонимаю.
- интерфейс и управление. Готовьтесь к тому, что традиционной логики игрового интерфейса и управления подразделениями здесь поровну с самобытностью (отсебятиной). Некоторые решения вас будут вгонять в ступор и взрывать мозг.
- отсутствие литературной составляющей брифингов, художественного оформления, исторической фотохроники событий отыгрываемых операции. Может кому-то пофиг, и он пойдет гуглить исторические книги, неделю-две вычитывать инфу об операции и потом отыгрывать, но это не про меня. У меня нет столько времени, а сухие 3 строчки в брифенге для меня чудовищно малы.
- обратная связь. Как-бы есть форум, но он скорее для галочки. Регистрация на нем - тот ещё ребус. Разработчики не умеют общаться с игроками и делают это через силу. В связи с чем, поддержка игры со стороны РУ комьюнити, в информационном пространстве, на низком уровне. Отлавливать многочисленные багги и выкладывать их на форуме – нет желания.
- он-лайн - его нет. 

Вместо итога.
Плоха ли игра? 
Однозначно нет. Она оригинальна и неповторима, обладает весомыми плюсами.

Значит игра хороша? 
Не совсем, т.к. в неё долго придётся учиться играть, в ней полно раздражающих криво реализованных решений и багов. 

Стоит ли игру покупать?
Да. Если вам нравятся сложные, правдоподобные, и в то же время зрелищные стратегии, то обязательно покупайте.

review:
I just discovered this game and I love it. One of the best game I ever played. I played a lot of close combat and this is such an improvement. It is not an easy game but it is worth learning it. 

This is realistic like close combat but with the physics of wargame red dragons. 

Only thing that could should be import from close combat is the sounds, they need to be more intense. 

If you like realistic wargame, try this. I hope future DLC will bring more countries and wars. I like to play battle editor with fantasy scenario. Like a modern russian platoon versus an ww2 german company and etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972452232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 5381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1034, 'last_played': 1697837480}
review:
Update: So, after a couple of years and more hours of playing, I thought it was time to update my very short original review – the game deserves it:


In short: It's an incredible and unique eastern-front simulator. I say simulator, because it really is not a game. There is nothing like it. I highly recommend it. 

1. It recreates historically accurate situation on the eastern front, with the battlegroups and equipment that actually fought there. This means, that the "game" is not balanced at all, it is historically accurately "unfair". As the Germans you'll have a hard time surviving endless waves of tanks with little anti-tank equipment - making winning very difficult. But then again: you are not really supposed to "win." The "game" does not expect you to win, but rather to recreate the events that transpired. However, it is not pre-determined. If you're really good, or lucky, you can still "win." It's just a challenge.


2. The simulator is incredibly "realistic." It is of course not truly realistic, but it is on "Combat Mission" or "Steel Beasts" levels of realism/simulation. There are countless things to point out, but e.g. tanks do not have a single "tank AI," but the individual crew members are simulated, complete with sight models, damage models etc. 
I'm still discovering new elements that are simulated in game. Some are not represented visually, but nevertheless simulated. Command and Control mechanisms, ammo sharing, you name it. 

3. The graphics: Dear god, where to begin, there is simply no game that recreates the carnage and hopelessness of war on a similar level. You feel really sorry for the troops in this game. 

4. DLC: The game is more of an engine/framework. The many excellent DLC provide different maps, fronts, weather conditions, equipment, and even completely new conflicts. There is really something for any taste: You want infantry combat? Panther tanks? Snow instead of summer? Cold War Africa instead of WW2? No problem. 


Negative points: 

- (not really a negaitve:) the game is difficult - like really difficult. The many simulated aspects (that aren't really explained or indicated) combined with the "unfair" situations you can encounter can make the game frustrating at times. But if you keep in mind that the real war was not fair at all either, it can be a source of challenge or intrigue (can I survive this overwhelming enemy advance?) 

- Many aspects are not really explained. A few times, what I thought were bugs turned out to be deliberate non-visual representations of certain elements. 

- The UI could be... more intuitive. But you get used to its particularities. 

Verdict: There truly is nothing like Graviteam Tactics. It is one of its kind. If you want realism, great atmosphere and historical accuracy in one package, buy it. Just don't give up after 2 hours. This game needs time to grow on one, but once you're hooked, there is no turning back. I wish more people knew about Graviteam. 


-> HIGHLY recommended!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056889507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 8115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5330, 'last_played': 1619894236}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009275233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1641939199}
review: If you love a good WW2 strategy game then this will make you very happy.  The interface and inner working of the game are a bit overwhelming at first but after playing the tutorials a couple of times and reading the manual I was able to understand most of what's going on.  This is no Company of Heroes though.  Be prepared to take battle planning seriously.  It's a high level strategy game not a traditional RTS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009734819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 7060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1710, 'last_played': 1644246105}
review:
[h1]Graviteam Tactics - Mius Front, en mi opinión la cúspide del realismo en el género de RTS.[/h1] 

[b]Mius Front toma lugar en el verano de 1943 en los meses siguientes a la legendaria batalla de Kursk, en esta entrega el Ejército Rojo esta a la ofensiva a lo largo de todo el frente del Este,  todo lo contrario a Operation Star, que tomaba lugar en las ofensivas Alemanas de 1942 como la “Operación Azul” y la contraofensiva de Kharkov en 1943 por Von Manstein, ahora son los Alemanes los que se ven obligados a estar a la defensiva.[/b]

Dejando el trasfondo a parte, Mius Front mejora prácticamente todos aspectos de Operation Star, se han añadido muchos sonidos nuevos,  pasando por artillería, ambientales, voces de los soldados, impactos, la lista es enorme. 

También se ha dado un lavado de cara al juego con nuevos gráficos, que quizás no estén a la altura de algunos RTS ahí fuera, pero desde luego no desentonan y una vez las batallas toman lugar es un autentico espectáculo visual.

La Aviación ha sido mejorada extensamente; En Operation Star la aviación jugaba un plano muy secundario con la participación de a lo sumo 6 aviones en alguna batalla, y que apenas tenían un rol decisivo en ellas. Mius Front es otra historia, la aviación aparecerá en escuadras de hasta 12 aparatos, volando en formaciones históricas tanto en la entrada como a la hora del ataque, contando con mucha más carga de proyectiles y bombas para prolongar su participación en la batalla, su precisión también ha sido aumentada; compañías enteras serán destruidas bajo lluvias de cohetes de los Sturmovik o las bombas de los Stuka o FW-190 Alemanes.

La Interfaz también ha recibido un merecido lavado de cara, aunque hay varias opciones que han sido removidas completamente y en mi opinión deberían seguir estando, pero por lo general lo hacen más cómodo usar las ordenes de movimiento y sobretodo la gestión de la artillería externa mediante operadores de radio, pudiendo seleccionar mucha más variedad de opciones para los modos de fuego y tipos de proyectil.

Otra mejora de la interfaz ha sido la implementación de un diagrama que muestra las penetraciones de todas las armas del juego contra el vehículo que tengas seleccionado en tiempo real, mostrándote los valores de penetración, blindaje en las diferentes partes del vehículo y la posibilidad que tiene la arma que tengas seleccionada de penetrarle a cada distancia, todo esto mientras te muestran una espectacular grafica en todos los ángulos del vehículo en medio de la batalla.

Pero no todo van a ser mejoras de interfaz, también nos han añadido nuevos juguetes a la ya extensa lista de material histórico del que dispone el juego, el temible ISU-152 es añadido al bando Soviético para competir con la potencia de fuego del Tigre Alemán y el M3 Scout (Vehículo Americano enviado a los Soviéticos ) para disponer de un vehículo de transporte blindado para las tropas mecanizadas, los Alemanes por su parte reciben el Stuig33, también conocido por ser el predecesor del Sturmpanzer “Brummbar” o el Sturmtiger, aparte de este vehículo también reciben una cantidad enorme de material  Soviético capturado en su mayoría cañones antitanque pero también se incluyen morteros e incluso T-34’s.

[b]Pero he de avisar que Graviteam Tactics no es un juego para el publico normal de los RTS, es un simulador extremadamente realista y duro, que no te va a llevar de la mano en ningún momento, al contrario te llevara al mismo infierno estratégico, sin posibilidad de guardar las campañas en ningún punto, cada decisión errónea retumbara en tu cabeza mientras tus unidades se enfrentaran a batallas imposibles donde al final tu única opción será la rendición.[/b]

La jugabilidad de Graviteam Tactics es muy compleja y tiene una curva de aprendizaje muy elevada, pero principalmente se desarrolla en dos fases, la primera es a nivel operacional, la fase operacional se juega por turnos, comenzando por el tuyo y seguido del de la IA sin posibilidad de guardar la partida en un punto, cada decisión que tomes será irreversible. 

El mapa operacional  te pone al mando de las tropas que había enmarcadas en las diferentes Divisiones, Brigadas o Regimientos que lucharon en las batallas históricas que ellos te plantean,  en esta fase deberás manejar la compleja logística que ello conlleva, organizando los movimientos y suministros de cada compañía anexa a su debido Batallón, esto puede sonar fácil pero cada Batallón puede que esté compuesto por hasta 17 Compañías diferentes, que toman forma de fichas en el mapa operacional, cada una con sus comandantes de Compañía y Batallón que proporcionan mejoras a la moral, la comandancia y las comunicaciones si participan conjuntamente o se encuentran adyacentes.  La cosa no termina aquí, puesto que cada unidad en el mapa operacional tiene su propia munición, moral, combustible y fatiga, haciendo que sea bastante difícil utilizar X número de tropas durante toda la campaña, ya que a la larga se quedaran sin efectivos con los que luchar, estarán demasiado agotadas para rendir adecuadamente o no tendrán munición, y créeme, la munición en este juego es el mayor problema al que se va a enfrentar nadie, la única forma de reabastecer unidades es mediante unidades especializadas que muchas veces solo te son concedidas cuando llevas X turnos en la campaña.

La segunda fase es el mapa táctico, donde jugaras las batallas que se produjeron en el modo operacional, aquí dispondrás de las tropas que se vieron involucradas y nada más, solo tendrás la opción de vencer o retirarte, la única ayuda externa que recibirás será el apoyo aéreo, suponiendo que dispongas de él  y los diferentes tipos de artillería externa que son solicitados mediante operadores de radio.  La fase táctica se juega como cualquier otro RTS en tiempo real, aunque aquí si tienes la posibilidad de pausar y avanzar rápidamente el desarrollo del juego, las unidades que comandaras serán los diferentes pelotones asociados a las compañías y otras unidades que tenias en el mapa, para haceros una idea, cada compañía suele variar en formato, tamaño y composición, una compañía de infantería por ejemplo, puede tener 8 pelotones asignados a ella, cada pelotón siendo independiente del resto y disponiendo de unos 10-12 soldados, o menos dependiendo de su rol (anticarro, reconocimiento, ingenieros, etc…)  Los vehículos funcionan diferente, ya que a veces están asociados en pelotones y otras en compañías, un pelotón de tanques dispondrá de por ejemplo 8 unidades, cada unidad siendo 1 tanque controlable independientemente del resto en el campo de batalla, mientras que una compañía de tanques quizás también disponga de 8 carros independientes pero te dejara reforzarla con pelotones de infantería, anticarro o artillería anexos a la compañía.

Podría seguir durante horas explicando cambios en el juego y mecánicas mejoradas, pero en lugar de una review estaría escribiendo un libro, así que iré directamente a la puntuación.

[b]Como era de esperar es un puto 10/10 igual que lo fue Operation Star. [/b]

Añadir también que este es de los pocos juegos a los que animo a comprar los DLC’s que los desarrolladores publican, en Operation Star compre la gran mayoría de los que publicaron y ninguno me defraudo, la mayoría añadían campañas interesantes, como Shilovo o el rescate de la División de Infantería 320th por parte de Joachim Peiper en el DLC de Krasnaya Polyana.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989910188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 6520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2276, 'last_played': 1710695005}
review:
I'm switching my review because of the pointless and unnecessary changes the developers made to the user interface, map, and unit control. They've ruined the flow of gameplay and watered down the gameplay mechanics. Now instead of being able to control individual squads and position them where you choose, you now have to select entire units and send them at the enemy with no strategy what so ever, because the UI and new gameplay mechanics dont allow for strategy. Want to position your MG squad on top of a hill while your rifle squads move up to a treeline to clear it of enemies? Nope! Can't do that anymore. Now you have to blob everyone together and just have them charge in. Want to strategically place your AT guns so they have overlapping fields of fire? Nope! Can't do that anymore. Now you have to blob them all together in one area. These changes were completely pointless and nobody asked for them. They say its for the sake of "micro" but thats just complete nonsense, they just didnt want to fix path finding issues for individual units and instead got rid of any ability to control squads.

UPDATE! I'm changing the review since the game actually feels quite good now. The units are more responsive and behave more realistically than before. The UI still annoys me but I've learned to manage its unwieldiness. I still wish they had the same marker brightness for "inactive" units like rifleman. The inactive markers for officers, tanks, and heavy weapons are still as bright as they were in Graviteam Tactics Operation Star but for some reason they decided to dim the marker brightness for rifleman. This severely limits your ability to judge where a large battle occurred as rifleman make up 70% of the infantry. The work around for this is dumb but it works, you have to position you camera behind a column of smoke from a grenade or explosion, the smoke will contrast with the dim gray inactive dots of the infantry and you can actually judge the size of a battle. If you don't do this it will essentially be impossible to see the gray dot for marking inactive infantry. Its a small thing and it doesnt affect the gameplay though, but it is annoying seeing a large firefight occur and not knowing how it panned out at a glance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966586365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1457770682}
review:
I'm a big fan of wargames; I grew up playing Combat Mission, really enjoy GMT board games, Paradox's strategy games, so it's not like i'm coming into this expecting Starcraft or Company of Heroes. Those are both great games but not the same genre, and I get that. 
But if I've put a good 5 hours into playing tutorials and attempting to get a handle on the gameplay mechanics and still totally fail, well that's when I put the game down for a time, maybe forever.

The interface and user feedback is just a mess overall, and even when I found something I didn't understand and looked in the manual to try and figure it out, for example the command points system, there was a one sentance description that did nothing to clarify how it worked. 
A multititude of vague icons and colors will indicate status' on units, but there's no way inside the game to find out what they mean if you don't already know. Would it really be that hard to have some nice tooltips on things? Even when tooltips are present they are often unhelpful or even more confusing. 

And I dare someone to try and find uglier menu graphics in a game that otherwise looks this pretty. Or to try and understand the after action report screen. (5/200% of what??)

This is all aside from other things i've seen that could either be a bugs in the combat engine/AI or interface and readabilty issues:
I've had tanks with no apparent damage, morale, or ammo issues, refuse to fire at enemy tanks a stone's throw away. 
Infantry carrying AT grenades run up to enemy armor then just stop and lay prone, or slowly crawl away, while the armor resolutely ignores them. 
Halftracks circling each other literally a couple feet apart, one unshooting, the other taking no damage whatsoever, for about 5-6 minutes. 
Infantry often seem to ignore heavy MG fire, and will jog straight up through an open field under heavy fire and murder the crew, with little or no damage.

Some or all of these could be bugs or things I missed in the interface that the game was trying to tell me about, I just have no idea.

Good complex games don't have to have bad interaces and tutorials. Crusader Kings 2 or Unity of Command are great examples of complicated games that are relatively easy to learn thanks to good tutorials, and give you all the needed information in game once you're there.

If you're really interested in this, at least watch a few long videos, or wait to see if they come out with some patches. I really hope they can improve things, because I can see the potential here, it's just not in a state I could recommened at the moment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006693546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1303, 'last_played': 1645864605}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997690278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 22918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3169, 'last_played': 1708163857}
review:
This is by far the best wargame I have played and I played a lot :-) 

The tactics involved are super realistic and cinematic at the same time - a rarity in the grognard wargaming community. There is something about the way battles occur, that make them stick in memory long after the computer has been turned off. At first the interface seems almost alien, but once you figure it out, it is very logical and easy to use.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021816241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 13465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1846, 'last_played': 1677064601}
review:
Its GTT, major AI improvements, all HD textures, vast armies, huge maps, improved reinforcement, improved (? still not totally sold) command interface and operations phase. 

To any armchair general who hasnt yet played GTT, buy it now! 

Spend some time to re-educate yourself, persevere, its a mysterious beast to begin with, then be prepared for the most accurately recreated "organic" warfare available on PC. 

This is a game where every battle has its heros, dissapointments and successes.  

Tactics work! You swing the battle to your favor, adjust, reinforce, withdraw or hold the line, not just 1,2,3 win, battles flow like everything you have read about in the history books. 

Wanna set up a rolling defence with a counter attack? Can do! 
Wanna have a solid frontline with some mobile fire teams? Can do! 
Need to replace that platoon running low on ammo with a reserve? Can do! 
Wanna bite your nails as your last Marder side slips into a ditch leaving your infantry to close assault the remaining enemy armour? Can do! 
Every battle is a story and due to its "Physics sandbox" style its never over until its over!

You need this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978926687', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 17553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1227, 'last_played': 1554558041}
review:
I have always loved the Graviteam games. I have all of the previous ones. I was very excited about this game because it's been in development for so long and promised so many new and wonderful things. 

I'm dissappointed. 

This is basically a map pack. And not a very good one at that. They dressed up the UI a bit and tweaked a few things, but really, if you've played the others, you've played this one. 

The Maps: Large stretches of land that are mostly flat with some rolling hills. The towns are just different arrangements of the same towns you saw in the previous games. There's not much strategy involved with such bland maps. If you have AT guns just pick a hill and they'll pick off the piecemeal attacks the AI sends your way. 

The Graphics: I guess they were upgraded, but I don't see it. It's that weird kind of upgrade that some games try that actually makes things look worse. 

The AI: I'd love to see some sort of fight being put up, but haven't yet. It's a drizzle of a tank or two, a squad or two, but nothing challenging. Not like the mass human waves you saw in Shilovo. It's like the enemy is content just probing, continuously. 

The Environment: Please for the love of God give me the winter back. I have no idea what environment they were trying to create here. It's dark and gloomy with the sun shining in the background. It's dingy brown with fresh spring grass growing. It's confused. 

The Campaign: Make a flat boring map, a generic arrangment of houses and dirt roads, and add in three times as many units for both sides. Voila! You have Mius Front.

The Bugs: Still there from the previous games. See a tank, see a tank disappear, see a tank appear, see a tank disappear. Hit a tank, wait ten seconds, hear tank get hit, wait ten seconds, see tank lose track. Fun.

Play the older games, this is garbage. 


Peace.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088235659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 999, 'last_played': 1664199456}
review:
Деление игры на две фазы, оперативную пошаговую и тактическую в реальном времени, немного не то, чего хотелось бы, ибо: вводить свежеприбывшие подразделения в бой сходу, пока враг не подтянул свои резервы не получится, ибо после  вашего хода в оперативной фазе, всегда следует ход врага, когда он не только подтянет в район вашего наступления свои резервы, но ещё и ударит в то место, которое вы ослабили, дабы создать мощную ударную группировку; не получится в тактической фазе окружить войска врага, которые он ОООЧЕНЬ тактично кучкует в центре карты, а потом забить на эту куче и продолжать наступление, при этом подтягивая резервы для разгрома окруженцев, ибо результаты тактической фазы переносятся на оперативную карту не динамически, а только после вашей победы/поражения в тактической фазе.
ИИ в игре - отдельная песня: тупой, слепой (с турдом находит стоящее в чистом поле в пятистах метрах орудие, а после одного выстрела по нему, опять теряет его из виду); из приказов хорошо понимает только указания на передвижение, приоритетную цель выставить невозможно, ибо он её либо не видит, либо считает, что полугусеничный БТР с пулемётом сможет причинить МОГУЧЕМУ КВ-1 больше вреда, чем Мардер/PaK 40; не помешало бы введение приказа на поиск цпротивника в указанном направлении с повышенным вниманием, ибо опять же Мардер/PaK 40 в чистом поле танкисты находят с огромным трудом, хотя им ничего не мешает высунуться из люка и (внимание, сейчас будет указано сложное действие, до которого даже Кинспель/Кариус/Виттман и Лавриненко не сразу додумались) посмотреть в бинокль; танкисты постоянно пытаются замаскироваться, что мешает ночью, когда хоть и можно указать пехоте следовать за танками, что плюс, однако, нельзя сделать так, чтобы командиры взводов держались позади своих подчинённых, а не подавали пример бесконечного мужества, идя на острие атаки, в результате чего моментально клеили ласты, и подчинённые ловили минус мораль, после чего шли сдаваться. 
В целом, сама концепция геймплея за комфронта интересна, нельзя не сказать об этом, но реализована она как-то не очень. Винить ли в этом разработчиков, или то, что сейчас просто среднестатистический компьютер не потянет боевые действия огромного масштаба на одной карте, где на каждом километре фронта будут бои, я не знаю, но то, что есть сейчас, точно не совсем похоже на то, о чём говорили полководцы в своих мемуарах. И это стоит учитывать при покупке игры. Однако, удовольствие от неё получить можно запросто, так же она вышла недавно, а это значит, что будет куча патчей, в которых, возможно, разработчики исправят тупой ИИ и сделают настойку сложности и реализма более гибкой.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020700513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 967, 'last_played': 1483420139}
review:
Game is amazing, frustrating and brutal all at once. UI and operations take some learning and getting used to, but it's definitely worth it. Battles feel and look brutal, from your infantry getting lit on fire by a hostile flamethrower wielding soldier you didn't see sprint up to your trench on the flank, to a tank crawling up a hill containing your defensive positions, only to catch a shell to the fuel tank and burst into flames and roll back down to the bottom of the hill. 

Night battles can be either maddening or fantastic. Maddening in the sense of not being able to spot shit until you have Russian infantry cuddling up to your frontline soldiers in their trenches, fanstastic that a Russian tank will roll right between two dug in positions with infantry hitching a ride on the back and not know it until a grenade catches it in the side and disables a track, getting it's hitchhikers caught in a bulletstorm. 

All in all, definitely a good purchase. This is the first time I've heard of Graviteam Tactics and I can definitely say I'm not disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980093009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 9115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 911, 'last_played': 1654656697}
review:
Updated Review: I had not a NO recommendation because I was below the recommended specs and the game suffered, HARD, on performance. It was like trying to play a slideshow. Here's my updated review:

Given the fact that I've recently upgraded my rig (considerably) with upper level components, this game runs smooth as silk now. This is the best 'war' simulator you're going to get on the market. It takes some getting used to because it's not a typical RTS control system. If you're thinking about getting this, look up the YouTube videos, there's more being uploaded for this game everyday. But if you're REALLY leaning on getting this game, then you owe it to yourself to watch the tutorials on the Operation Star gameplay. While this game is much improved in many ways (UI is more intuitive, AI is better, etc...), the core gameplay and approach is pretty much the same between the two games. If the tutorials on YouTube for Operation Star seem like your cup of tea, then this is a game you will really learn to love. 

I'm looking forward to mods and DLC. 
This game is HIGHLY recommended *If you and ONLY if you meet the recommended specs*

ITA:

author: {'steamid': '76561198006920127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1645636337}
review:
How this game has not been more noticed in beyond me.

The learningcurve is steep but mostly in terms of the interface and all the hidden features in tactical mode rather than the gameplay itself. At least for someone like myself with many years of real life military training and experience and that's one of the first games that's actually managed to just seamlessly blend a game with the feel of a professional military wargame.

The feel and flow of the game is purely outstanding. It does just about everything right compared to the competition and the realism and flow of combat is so nicely done real life battalion tactics simply work out of the box, without requiring a second thought on game-mechanics.

If you enjoy titles like Combat Mission, Close Combat etc this is a must have. If you like titles like Company of Heroes but  want more realism and want to get an idea of the challenges of realistic large-scale combat then this is also something I recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970690486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1703677278}

author: {'steamid': '76561198097529540', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1158, 'last_played': 1587206801}
review:
Probably the best wargame of this scale around. 
In this game you get the feeling of being a commander, moving companies and platoons: you aren't the micromanaging-wierdo which we see in many games, where an hypotetical ww2 "general" go from soldier to soldier telling him where to aim, take cover behind that rock, switch to that grenade. In Mius Front the AI can handle that, and while you can certainly micromanage the placement of an AT gun in an ambush position, or should the need arise command single squad in a platoon, you do it only when you need it.
The game has a turn-based operational layer, where you move platoons and manage your force calling reinforcements from your OOB. When the movement phase ends battles are resolved in the tactical mode, where you not only get to move troops in the field, but can also please your eyes at the really nice graphics, unrivalled in a game of this genre, which mantains a solid grip on realism and historical accuracy. In fact OOBs are historically accurate ( you will not see hordes of Tigers) and also gun penetration and vehicle damage mechanics are nicely modelled, without health bars which we see in too many games.
Finally a HUGE plus of this game is the non-scripted AI. It's nice playing Combat Mission, but when you fall in that scripted ambush you will never fall for it again. Here nothing is apparently scripted: the AI can make good or stupid decisions, but will never make the same thing again over and over. This make the two campaigns (for each side) more replayable.
Do not forget that there is also a battle editor, which allows for the creation of every battle you like using the campaign map.
Compared to Operation Star there has been an improvement in the UI and several addictions, like better artillery support managament and tanks laying smoke for infantry to advance behind. Howewer, the sheer amount of content and campaigns of Operation Star with all the DLCs still make it worth buying imho. 
If i have to complain about something that would be the actual lack of multiplayer (which howewer seems to be added at some point, maybe as a free dlc. There is already a MP option in the menu but only as a placeholder). The learning curve is pretty steep like many games of this genre, and for a newb even with the tutorial it may be hard to get into the game.
 Also i hope they will make many DLCs like they did with GT:OS.
For the techical part, as of now i haven't had a single crash. There are some minor bugs, like two infantry soldier stacking on each other, or the tank sinking in soft ground mechanics which need some work.
The game is maybe a little less well optimized than his predecessor, with all things at maximum my GTX 670 can't always mantain 60fps, and in smoke clusterfucks fps can really drop. Still you can scale the graphics with many options.

TL;DR version: 
+ best game of this scale
+ two layers, operational and tactical
+ nice graphics
+ good approach (no need for excessive micromanaging)
+ not scripted AI
+ muh realism

- multiplayer still to be added
- steep learning curve for newbies of the genre

author: {'steamid': '76561198022621729', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 4515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1704103673}

author: {'steamid': '76561198075609469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1669630515}
review:
I am a very avid wargamer and have played a decent amount of titles, and this game is possibly one of the best wargames out there for its scope. There are several layers to wargames, strategic, operational, tactical and this game falls under the category of the last two for how the game plays out in its two phases. The first is a layer which shows a large map consisting of a company sized force. Which is organized down to battalion, platoon and at the lowest level, squad. 

Those that bought this game right away are fans of the first Graviteam game Operation Star, which was a gem in its own right but had its problems which come naturally from a Ukranian/Russian game studio. The most obvious of which is a very confusing user interface. Although it did change from GTOS there is an increased amount of abstraction but gives a decent amount of info. The first game allowed you to detach units from the reserve groups and manually attach them to platoons with a spare space. This is changed in this game because now you do not have the option to attach these reserves on a specific nature. Instead you choose the type on reinforcement on the management screen, and then hope you got what you wanted. For instance in the first you could move an anti tank rifle squad into a platoon, nice and simple, but now you would select "anti-tank" and you may get that squad, or a gun. If you select support you may get a mortar or an arty spotter. This simulates the "you get what you are given so stop complaining" nature of warfare but sacrifices control of platoon composition

The graphics are amazing, and are much improved from the last game. It looks great, so I'll leave it at that.

Sound is a bit to be desired with slightly cut off and strange sounding guns and explosions, however these will be modded in the near future. Going down close to soldiers also lets you hear them laughing...really...damn...awkwardly

Tactical battles are a work of art but leave a little to be desired in regards of unit control. This game simulates high level command so there is only so much you can control. All you can basically do is tell your units to move in a certain formation, face a direction and give target priorities. Although you can adjust the modifiers of how your units move in a neat radial menu. I would like to be able to adjust rate of fire, and grenade usage. However this will be forgotten in the heat of battle.

As I said before, the UI sucks. Its horrible, its ugly, and its only a minor improvement from GTOS. The manual does not help with this..

Lets conclude this haphazard review. This game is NOT for casual strategy fans, that comes out as elitist, but this game is designed for a very niche group of people called Grognards, these people play very abstracted games focused on wargames with a high level of complexity. This is reflected in the type of warfare that plays out which is primarily skirmisher warfare. Where units get into trenches, spot the enemy and fight a battle of attrition. You wont flank through gullys, charge a fortification or storm a building. You will be placing your units through forests and positioning at the edge for them to fire at the enemy. This is pure skirmisher warfare and it is not for those expecting a Company Of Heroes or Men of War Experience. Behind the bad UI is a beautiful gem of a wargame that can allow one to simulate high command on a operational and tactical level. Where you can give general orders to your units and hope they have the strength to carry them out. This game is for wargamers, and not for people looking for a quick campaign.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977533136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1615186453}
review: A fantastic grog game. The battles play out in cinematic style and by the end the field is littered with burnt out tank husks and dead soldiers. Slow burning fire consume grass and trenches turn into large crates as they are deformed. It's a joy to watch battles unfield in such vivd detail. The UI leaves a lot to be desired but the game itself is pretty easy to jump into (doubley so if you've place a previous Graviteam game or Combat Mission). If you're at all interested in a more serious WW2 game pick this up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010199313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 22416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1245, 'last_played': 1708960934}
review:
For people who grew up on games like Close Combat, this is a must have. 

For people who just stumbled upon it, please have a look at a few videos that are out there to see if this is your cup of tea. It's not like Men of War or Company of Heroes. It's closer to Close Combat, Combat mission or perhaps Theater of War. 

Some improvements for people who played the previous version GT:OS 

- Improved and friendlier UI
- Much better english language support
- Soldier Speech slightly better :)
- Soldiers honor direction commands now, it seems
- Bigger scale conflicts
- New features and mechanics - smoke, infantry + tank assault formations, etc. 
- Better FX and much better sound effects out of the box. 

Overview and interesting points for people new to the game:

- Battalion level tactical simulation of ww2 on the eastern front
- Mix of turn based operation map and real time tactical map
- Realistic tank vs tank warfare, balistics calculations, angle, temperature, wind, slope, type of ammo and area hit will determine what damage is caused etc. (dozens of possible damage types - chassis, tracks, turret ring, optical sight, etc.)
- Vehicle modelling, animation and texturing
- No game helps you to understand the principles of RL combat like this game.

Things that still need work or modding:

- russian infantry speech
- soldier models, textures and animations (more variety to the faces would be awesome!)
- AI could do with a bit more work.  It's decent as it is - just not aggressive and determined enough.
- a few sound fx need replacing, but it's a minority

author: {'steamid': '76561197977231083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 7863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2447, 'last_played': 1674904551}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054463479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 2708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2070, 'last_played': 1667519972}
review:
After playing this a few days, I have decided to thumbs down.
The reasons for the thumbs down:
False advertising possibly.  Under system requirements on store page, "Storage: 5 GB available space ", yet download and installed space used was 1.1 GB. 
Poor FPS
Very bad language barrier. 
Very incomplete manual and instructions on how the game works. 
The forum is a joke due to said language barrier, and I will not even attempt to waste my time on there.

Is the game worth $31.49 on sale? NO
$20? NO
$10? Maybe
$5? Yep

After I spent some time figuring out some of the how to play, I have found some aspects almost enjoyable. (Although ALL tracer rounds fly over ALL enemies and never hit a darn thing.) The AI path finding on vehicles seems terrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969026554', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1490248580}
review:
2016/03/08 15:11:09 10 11...(美國時間)
首先在此做為中文玩家，我得說的是這遊戲挺不錯的。做為一個所謂的 "RTT" 來說。
戰鬥時長可以設定為 30mins 1hr 2hrs 3hrs，單位的部份也是十分細節的很好。
做為一個策略模擬，它帶來了43年蘇德戰場中位於米烏斯河一條戰線的戰役。同樣也是比較關鍵導致整個庫爾斯克會戰失敗的重要戰役之一。
於遊戲目前所開放的官方戰役中為43年7月和8月的兩次戰役。
接著，讓我們來談談它的優缺點吧

[h1]優點[/h1]
[b]1.[/b]精準的徽記 章牌 (此項目並不開放於美區/歐區)
[b]2.[/b]從41年到43年的史實部隊
[b]3.[/b]挺真實地戰鬥
[b]4.[/b]還算可以的UI
[b]5.[/b]完美的TIME KILLER
[b]6.[/b]配置親民 (我一個I5的蘇菲破3都能低配流暢玩這遊戲)
[h1]缺點[/h1]
[b]1.[/b]煩瑣的操作
[b]2.[/b]並不是太詳細的教學
[b]3.[/b]需要深入的研究
[b]4.[/b]過於高的難度
[b]5.[/b]完美的TIME KILLER

此遊戲推薦給 二戰愛好著 德粉/棍 蘇粉/糞 軍事模擬家 (?) 策略遊戲玩家 喜愛煩瑣操作的玩家

author: {'steamid': '76561198014187783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1493, 'last_played': 1489597408}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067430886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1625151037}
review:
This game is simply amazing! 

The only game I know so far where tanks are tanks. They move like tanks, shoot like tanks. A typical range of tank shoot is 1000 meters here. And I must admin this is quite realistic.

All aspects of war are so detailed here that I even can't say what also should be implemented. Maybe fighters?

author: {'steamid': '76561198104377869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1103, 'last_played': 1595105089}
review:
Mius is Graviteam's latest deeply complex wargame, which we can expect to receive constant attention from the developers for many years to come.  Mius breaks new ground in Graviteam's steady march toward a true battlefield simulator.  

Compared to prior titles, Mius brings noticeably enhanced graphics, a more elegant interface, more units on the field, more complex AI behavior, more complex munitions, more extensive use of air support in combined arms combat, smoke screen, artillery fuse settings, and more.  

The developers respond quickly to reports of flaws and they are always working on new features and DLCs.  Prices are always reasonable, but sale prices outright undervalue the game.

As with all Graviteam titles, Mius is not a game you can just pick up and play.  You have to learn the interface and commands, in addition to the funcitionality of all the weapons systems in the game.  You have to understand the effects of terrain, down to whether your heavy weapons can move through a muddy field.  You have to understand the effects of weather, such as how to deal with wind or storms.  

Beware that you will only find Mius' greatest rewards after extensive efforts to understand details of the battlefield.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037343693', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1665890961}
review: Just like Graviteam tactics operation star, this game is stupid hard and realistic.  Which is what I want to see in a RTS.  This has a better tutorial, but even those are hard to succeed with.  This game has a lot to offer, but the learning curve is very steep.  I highly recomend this game if realism at any cost is what you're looking for.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984487409', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 4304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1485, 'last_played': 1495403786}
review:
Did you like the older graviteam tactics games? Did you want it bigger and with more options? well HERE IT IS!

Yes there are not many campaigns to run, but the battles are massive now and much more intense. My first battle was some 400 germans holding off 700 russian troops! It encompassed 30+ Russian tanks, massive artilley barrages and planes divebombing! What is not to like about that? (Do note it was a graphic/CPU hog during the intense action, as i fell to 40 FPS and I have a good rig)

This is the wargame for strategy fans, and great if you liked the other games in the series.

A solid must buy, at the VERY least when its on sale.



Note: a few minor bugs encountered, but nothing game breaking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033650250', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1646011634}
review: GRAVITEAM.......what cant i say but AMAZING .....this game is like a cross between TOTAL WAR @ COMPANY OF HEROES ... a bit hard at the begining but few hours of game play and you will get the hang of it........ the battles are so big and last about two hours to WIN-LOSE or even a DRAW....for real lovers of RTS this is made for....Iv been a fan for many years i have GTOS= and all its DLCs and i must give Mius-Front ....10/10....

author: {'steamid': '76561198034166024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1461806397}
review:
Okay so here we are now on Mius Front, lets start right off the bat and say that this game is extremely cool for what you get. 
Well the premise of it is cool anyways.
This game is made by the usual E. Europe devs who don't really understand the concept of "hey lets not throw a million buttons and leave things uncomplicated" 
The turorial is a nightmare and you often don't even understand why you lost in a tutorial
You rarely even understand what the overall objectives are and some things are absolute nonsense. I have played complicated games as they are my absolute favorite but this isn't "complicated" this is a button-tastic nightmare of confusing commands and silly overlays. The FPS drops are also extremely ridiculous as I can run ArmA 3 on Ultra in a city of 100 people and get 50 FPS but I get 26 FPS here in combat. 
Oh and combat, lets go there. You don't tell your guys who to attack and you just make suggestions. For instance I have a PaK with a T-70 right in front of it. It could hit it perfectly and I designated that "Priority Target" The PaK gun crew laughed at me and continued firing at infantry. 
The sounds of this game are also absolutely, extremely terrible and overall it isn't an enjoyable experience. It would be more fun with multiplayer as well but thats "coming later".
You spend 30-40$ and you expect a game that you can make sense of and enjoy, right? Well don't look here for that.
Also to the fanboys, yes I have played multiple extremely difficult games. No I won't go back to (insert pleb-tier game) because I am not from there. 
Devs, I don't know how you can fix it but if you do I will buy it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144660823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 25803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1278, 'last_played': 1689980694}
review:
I'm someone who never had an issue with the previous games UI, however though many prefer this version I find it more complex.


Saying that once the battles start it's absolutely awesome. I usually HATE real time games. The only ones I've enjoyed are Command Ops series, the very first Close Combat games (esp CC2) and this series. Reason is they aren't a click fest and are manageable. Great to see this one runs along the same lines.

With the Battle Editor you have loads of replayability.

Also a tip, even veterans of the series MUST go through the tutorials scenarios and vids that you can find in Quick Battles. Helped me alot. Though still unsure of certain aspects..I reckon it will all sink in in time.

Anyway just like the previous game it comes highly recommended.

This is a proper tactical wargame. It's not COH or MOW. For those wanting to get more "real"  and despite the UI you really must step it up and buy this game. The only other tactical wargame in 3D as complex is the Combat Mission series and they too come highly recommneded. I prefer the CM serie sonly because of the WEGO aspect in those games. If it wasn't for that GTMF and OS come out on top for a superb tactical wargame experienece.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989697763', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 883, 'last_played': 1547902370}
review:
Klasse WW2 Strategie.Operation Star hat spaß gemacht, Mius Front ist Großartig. Die Bedinung geht gut von der Hand.Ist zwar eine steile Lernkurve aber man wird belohnt. Die Grafik ist zum Vorgänger aufgefrischt und sieht super aus.
Man wird noch lange Spaß an dem Spiel haben da sicher einige DLCs kommen werden .

author: {'steamid': '76561198028649652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1464082373}
review: Operation Star: Moderately improved and set in 1943.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049982537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 65695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 68, 'playtime_at_review': 994, 'last_played': 1712106228}
review:
What can I say that hasn't already been said?

I'll just keep it short and to the point. Mius Front is a rare bird.  An incredible game where deep strategy meets in a real time world.  Players that can navigate a UI that, out of necessity, is very complex, yet gets easier each time you play, are rewarded with the most realistic WWII experience out there. Quite simply, there is nothing else like it that integrates operational aspects and tactical battles with such wonderful results. Graviteam included so many small details in this game that other developers overlook that make it truly unique. A masterpiece. But not for the feint of heart. It takes commitment to be an effective commander. That is my only warning. 

9.8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970904035', 'num_games_owned': 830, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1682385234}
review:
It doesn't get much better than this!  Yes it has a steep learning curve but the more you play the easier it gets.
This is not for the faint of heart, this is a serious simulation.

If you got the balls, GET IT!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982848113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1668394498}

author: {'steamid': '76561198108623278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 38, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1711320434}
review:
Graviteam has managed to deliver us in the last past 3 years, a game experience in wwII sim that goes beyond any other ww2 tactic game out there. Once you understand the commands and put in application the military wwII knowledge you have, it will became yor best wargame experience. Is just amazing how this small group transformed they're talent in this amazing product, and I am pretty sure that one day they will stay alongside to great developers. 


-> amazing attention to details: the models are carefully reconstructed taking in consideration, the historical period and                place, original footage and documents were consulted for the modeling.
-> real tellecomunication system: the communication is very real in the way is reproduced, were fog and bad weather play an important factor.
-> armor penetration and ammunition: realistic effect on tanks armor depending on the shell type angle and distance.
-> map reproduction: every cm of the map was reconstructed on topographic maps basis (wwII era), amazing care for the dettails in general.


This is a must if you love WWII tactic sim.

review: No other game , CMRT included, does convey the scale and brutality of eastern front in WW II so well. Persevere , and after   initial confusion you will apreciate how deep this battalion size simulation is. Great price too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999454942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1665745445}
review: You could say its a mix out of mow and a bit Total war + Very long battles. I think its fun but you actually need Patience. I'm new to this game and i still dont have a clue of lots of things but you learn fast the gameplay mechanics (the tutorial is under quick battles) also the manual is very handy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012405765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2137, 'last_played': 1596561783}
review:
Перспективная игра, с серьёзным упреком на историчность и реалистичность боевых действий в целом, от командования, ттх техники и вооружения! 
Что только стоит проработанная дамаг модель техники, пробития, рикошеты, толщина брони всем это давно уже известно и действует здесь по всем законам! Подбитый горящий танк, экипаж в панике выпрыгивает на ходу, техника продолжает своё движение без экипажа, танк догорает и в нем начинает взрываться бк, рядом с танком находиться уже опасно, отлетают катки, рвутся гусеницы, от снарядов устаёт земля и деформируется под танками, терраморфинг в действии! И многие другие нюансы и мелочи, от которых начинаешь верить в эту страшную картину происходящего боя, вы будто командир тех лет!

Есть и недостатки, пока не понятные действия со стороны Ai пехота, танки бывают "тупят" в казалось бы, простых ситуациях например:  танки разворачиваются бортом а то и хуже кормой, не могут определиться с целью сначала наводятся на одну цель не решаются открыть огонь, потом переводятся на другую и снова передумали, пехота видит в упор и не стреляет в противника итд. Может быть где то стоит дать управление игроку или изменить действия того же Ai обойтись каким-нибудь скриптом, к примеру стрелять в такой момент что ли! Думаю все эти огрехи преодолимы!

Интересно наблюдать за развитием игры от серии к серии, много нововведений, в целом игра заслуживает внимания! Разработчикам терпения в этом не легком деле, тем более я так понимаю штат разработчиков не такой уж и большой по сегодняшним меркам то, поддержим разрабов ребят!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049806292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 31172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2461, 'last_played': 1648378005}
review:
There is an amazing game in here. You just have to find it.

I want you to look at the highest rated pictures for Graviteam Mius. That is how the game feels once you learn to play it. But you have to learn it, and it takes time, and before you do it won't look or play at all how the pictures feel. When I first bought Graviteam's other game, Operation Star, I had heard good things about it but was sorely dissapointed the first couple times I tried playing. It just didn't seem to "have it". I let it go for a couple months.

But then I came back, and really tried to learn it. Turns out, I was completely wrong. If you like WW2 and strategy, it's a crime not to devote a couple hours to learning this game if you can. It's one of, if not the best. You just have to give it time, and you will be rewarded.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007168503', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 95361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2066, 'last_played': 1710514667}
review: I'm going to write a proper review later on as I cant stop playing this utterly brillant simulation of ww2 combat....I need sleep back later.....

author: {'steamid': '76561197985226443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1535338860}
review:
Was doing the tutorial and had to assault a position and little did I know there was an enemy platoon and a 5cm Pak gun on the hill to my right. Unfortunately it destroyed both my T-34s and all my infantry where mowed down by heavy LMG fire except for one soviet peasant with his Mosin. He made it all the way to the objective to be subsequently kicked in the ass by a nazi that appeared behind him from a smoke screen and died in a pool of blood.

10/10 would get my ass kicked in the tutorial again.

Congrats to Graviteam for a job well done!

Pros
-Acutal tutorials this time to help get you started.
-The graphics are much improved.
-Sound is a lot better
-UI is very easy to use and everyting has tool tips. The basic commands are accessed by a right click and a wheel menu and if you click again all the advance  commands show up in an outer wheel if that makes sense.



Cons
-I was going to write content but since I paid about $30 its a non issue. Going to get my moneys worth.
-Single Player only? I thought read somewhere it was single player only but I saw options for multiplayer and didnt get to  try. Maybe it will be added later.

If you liked CM, GTOS, or Close Combat you need to add this to your library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061103115', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1472516405}
review: Da hora

author: {'steamid': '76561198007033308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 13026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 20, 'playtime_at_review': 977, 'last_played': 1712434940}
review:
An amazing achievement and a worthy successor to Operation Star.

For anyone unfamiliar with Graviteam's games -- yes, there is a considerable learning curve. It requires a real commitment to learn how to play. There will be some frustrations intially. But if you are willing to persevere, check out some YouTube tutorials and wargaming forums, do some trial and error, you will be rewarded by what may well be the greatest serious/historical tactical-level World War II game ever made. 

The charges of the 'terrible' 'clunky' UI are overblown. Yes, the UI is *unique* -- it's unlike anything you've encountered elsewhere. It does take some getting used to. Yes, the documentation (manual) is lacking -- although the ingame tutorials are decent. But once you understand the UI, you will find it a flexible and powerful tool for managing the game and for crafting battlefield strategems that are surprisingly and satisfyingly multifaceted. 

I've seen some complaints about performance issues -- not sure what to say there, except that I've found Operation Star and now Mius Front both very stable (no crashes) and well optimized. I'm playing on a fairly robust rig (GTX 780 Ti, i7 3770K o/c to 4.6 GHz, 16 Gigs RAM) and the game is completely fluid on max graphics settings. And it is *gorgeous*. The modeling of terrain is amazing. And these are hands-down the most beautifully detailed vehicle models you  will find in a WW2 game.

Cannot recommend highly enough. A masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006602028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 18700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2353, 'last_played': 1698100323}
review:
Graviteam Tactics: Mius-Front comes closer than any other game I have yet played to representing the complex situational challenges of the battlefield. It is a superb game, limited only by a weak marketing, that every serious war gamer should definitely have in his or her stable. 

Graviteam has clearly been designed by a team with a deep understanding of military tactics and a passion for realism and historical accuracy.
 I can't praise the game highly enough and I can only say to those of you who have not yet purchased it, or who gave up on Graviteam because of its complexity, that you are missing out on the opportunity to experience and contribute to the finest war simulation ever made.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963657733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1693361622}
review:
Mius-Front is an improvement to Graviteam Tactics: Operation Star in many ways from controls to sound. The series is one of the best wargames I have ever played and I've played them all ( I am not a youngster) from HPS to Matrix Games .Graviteam Tactics: Mius-Front along with Graviteam Tactics: Operation Star & Expansions create a WWll atmosphere that is both operational and very tactical. The games in this series are so involved that many more experienced players than myself are still learning hidden gems about the game's depth even after many weeks/months of play. 

Go over to Youtube and you will find some really good videos explaining things like movement, units, artillery, German Tanks,Russian Tanks,commanders and much, much more. If you like detail in your wargames this is definitly worth the time to learn!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968652581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 6458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1710815864}
review:
Any game where you can run over dudes in trenches with tanks to kill them is OK in my book.  
 
This game is so good its funny. I still do not know the intricacies of the game completely. When that happens they better cancel Christmas.  
 
Like other reviewers have said, its like Combat Mission games with less micro and more macro. You are more a battalion commander rather than every single officer in the game. Oh and its half the price of those games.  
 
The operational interface is a bit obtuse, but with a little time, its workable. The actual battles are nothing short of amazing.  The AI is decent too. I've see flanking maneuvers, over watch tactics, ambushes, etc. all executed by the AI. They also run over dudes in trenches with tanks. Also a very deft, albeit direct, tactic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970342576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1665685209}
review:
I don't want to repeat what others said, simply put: It is a Masterpiece. 

If you want to experience WW2 battles which are dynamic and most intense, together with absolute accurate 3D Models of Hardware this is for you. Together with an incredible intelligently programmed campaign mode this game is king.

Please read the manual, look into Quick Battles for short Tutorials and be patient learning the game - you will be rewarded, promise!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012882014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 15603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1644193868}
review: Mius Front is a worthy "sequel" to operation Star, with a more streamlined UI and a new front to fight on Mius Front delivers for ww2 simulation fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981334633', 'num_games_owned': 720, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 8549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2359, 'last_played': 1645611985}
review:
Когда мы говорим РТС - подразумеваем такие вехи жанра как C&C, Варкрафт и Старкрафт, где есть отдельные юниты с уровнем хп, ресурсы, строительство и т.д.
Развивая жанр РТС, разработчиков кидало то в сторону "хардкорных" РТС типа Противостояния, Блицкрига, то в сторону "cмеси" жанров как DARWINIA или Dungeon Keeper
Mius-Front это лучше, что могло случиться с хардкорными РТС, лучше нет и не предвидиться.
Брать обязательно!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060557433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1711496860}
review: Still trying to figure it out but VERY Historically Accurate!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001977495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 4031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1710121679}
review:
Best in the series easy to recommend as a buy;

The new interface took some getting used to but it's much imporved over prior operatoin star interfaces.   They took what was good about the prior series and enhanced it to make a better game.   They did not try to reinvent the wheel which is good because we all know the wheel works well.

Graphically it's the best looking game in the series.   The tutorials are a welcome addition and I learned a lot going through them as well as the players guide.  The landscape and terrain are well done and the roughness and variety of terrain make many tactical options possible that could not be done prior.   AI is as good or better in some cases as the prior games it seems.    Any fan of combnat mission or prior graviteam products should like this one.   For new players this is more of a tactical wargame with a high level of complexity, if expecting something like battlefield...don't.

8.5/10 - highly recommend  .  Like any new game of this depth, it will grow and get better with time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984645205', 'num_games_owned': 1609, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 3307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1634824837}

author: {'steamid': '76561198121523518', 'num_games_owned': 794, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 6588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1694438704}
review: Fun game, a lot more improved over GTOS, way more optimized, has a better UI, and can run on max settings without dipping frames with many units on screen. If you're an armchair general like me and like games like wargame or men of war, and want something a bit more realistic and challenging this is the game for you. Only thing is, is that AI could use some improvements, they can be a bit janky, especially in close quarters situations, which you rarely end up in anyway. Could also use some more units and models, but more than likely these will be released in DLC similarly to GTOS. It's not your typical rts, but it scratches an itch not many games can come close to with it's level of realism, you don't fully control units, it's more like you're a commander issuing orders that the AI will carry out. It's a one of a kind game in a very niche market that can create some epic battles and memorable moments and for the commander in me, it's a must-buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271102897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1688638450}
